This platform helps me share knowledge, raise awareness, and educate more people about the Cloud Native ecosystem and the tools and technologies that power it.

Finally, as a DevOps Cloud Engineer, one focuses on automation and CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, Kubernetes, Ansible and Terraform, ensuring efficient and scalable cloud infrastructure. I love DevOps and Kubernetes from day 1

name: Alan Flower
bio:
Alan heads the HCL Cloud Native & AI Labs business and is also the HCL CTO for Cloud Native.  A successful entrepreneur and technologist, Alan is deeply passionate about using technology to support the digital transformation of business and driving the creation of innovative products and services.

Alan has an extensive track record as both a visionary and thought leader. He combines in-depth engineering credibility with real hands-on experience leading global technology organizations. With a track record of bringing over 250 software products to market, Alan has a unique perspective on the application of modern Cloud-enabled services to accelerate market success.

HCL Cloud Native & AI Labs are the HCL Centre of Excellence, helping clients leverage modern technologies and practices to accelerate transformation.

Working closely with HCL ecosystem partners, the Labs showcase the Art-of-the-Possible, and with a track record of over 1,000 engagements, the Labs are uniquely positioned to guide our clients’ complete journey.

The Labs provide engineering assistance to modernize existing applications, or to create innovative new solutions. Deeply collaborative, our Labs also provide education and skills modernization to support the cultural transformation necessary to make the vision of a Cloud Native Enterprise become a reality.

Alan leads HCL corporate participation in leading open-source communities such as the Linux Foundation and the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

He is a Fellow of both the British Computer Society and a Fellow of the Institute of Enterprise and Entrepreneurs.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF Ambassador is an exciting opportunity for me to expand my reach and impact within the community. As someone who is already involved in mentoring and contributor growth activities at CNCF, I'm eager to use the ambassador title to promote CNCF technologies, open-source software, and help interested individuals get started with contributing to CNCF projects. Additionally, being part of a network of other CNCF Ambassadors will allow me to collaborate and share ideas with like-minded individuals who are passionate about the same things. I'm excited to be part of this community and look forward to making a meaningful impact.

As a founding member of the CNCF’s End User TAB, Alolita has facilitated participation and contributions by CNCF end user members. She has also promoted end user priorities to the CNCF TOC and Governing Board. Within her rich track record, Alolita has demonstrated a deep commitment to CNCF's goals and initiatives. Alolita brings a wealth of experience from her board leadership roles in the industry. For example, she has served on the boards of the OSI, SFLC.in and Unicode Consortium. Alolita has also provided strong leadership for observability and search engineering at AWS and has managed engineering teams at IBM, PayPal, Twitter, and Wikipedia.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I want to continue giving back to the CNCF community, I see this as another great opportunity to connect with other developers (open source and end users) and learn about their struggles with current tooling to help shape where this industry moves toward. I'm also very excited to empower others to see that they too belong in tech, that there is space for them to work in cloud-native, and become open-source contributors, and for folks to join in and help us grow this community and build responsible tech.

And now say something for myself and "well done".

name: Andre Kämmerer
bio: Starting my journey as a Linux system engineer, evolving through roles as DevOps engineer and now being a cloud engineer, I have discovered my passion for automation and cloud technologies. With expertise in Cloud (Azure), Kubernetes (AKS, on-prem), IaC (Terraform, Ansible, Puppet), software development (Python), CI/CD (GitHub actions, FluxCD, ArgoCD) and monitoring (Prometheus, Icinga), I am always excited to dive into new innovations. I love sharing my knowledge and discussing challenging topics to support others in their development and success.

name: Andrea Giardini
bio:
I am a freelance cloud-native engineer and trainer based in Amsterdam. When I am not coding, I enjoy helping the community by organizing meetups, Kubernetes community days, and workshops on cloud technologies.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Ambassadors are a point of reference in the cloud native community and help many initiatives come to life. I want to empower talented individuals to realize their ambitions and help the CNCF to reach a wider community through events, meetups, and mentoring. I want to make a difference by empowering others.

name: Andreas Døhl
bio: Cloud security consultant from Norway focused on Kubernetes security, policy enforcement, and runtime hardening. I advise teams on how to build secure, scalable platforms — from pipelines to production clusters.

name: Andreas Erlandsson
bio: Andreas is a platform engineer consultant at Bonfire Cloud & Engineering. He has 15+ years of experience in IT and provides products and services for internal development teams. He's an organizer of the Gothenburg chapter for CNCF communities.

name: Andreas Grabner
bio:
Been working in software since 1998 and from the early days was drawn to performance engineering, observability and more recently on DevOps, SRE, Platform Engineering. I am an active contributor to the CNCF project Keptn, I am a podcaster, I create YouTube tutorials and occasionally blog as well! Besides IT I am passionate about salsa dancing :-)

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The success of any community depends on the people that actively drive community activities (bringing people together, educating, making them feel comfortable ..) and the members of the community that then want to join, grow and eventually contribute back to that community. I am excited to get the chance to help grow the community with my goal to inspire many others to do the same

name: Andreas Lote Rosland
bio: I'm Andreas, a cloud and platform engineer with a deep passion for containerized technologies. I leverage Infrastructure as Code (IaC), automation pipelines, and Kubernetes to build robust and scalable infrastructure. I'm constantly seeking ways to improve containerized solutions, and I'm always happy to connect with others who share this interest.

name: Andrei Ivantsov
bio: I am a passionate software engineer with deep expertise in cloud-native technologies, specializing in Kubernetes to build scalable, resilient, and secure architectures. With a strong focus on continuous improvement, I leverage state-of-the-art technologies to drive innovation throughout the software lifecycle. As a team player, I thrive in collaborative environments, fostering knowledge sharing and best practices. Committed to software craftsmanship, I view the IT industry as a lifelong learning journey, always embracing new challenges and advancements.

name: Andrei Pirjol
bio: I am Senior Data Engineer working in the fintech landscape here in London, will start soon a new gig, I work a lot with automation tools (IaC, Go, Python), cloud technologies, CI/CD tools (Concourse, Jenkins), I have fun with a lot of Kubernetes related tasks at work. Fun fact, I am also fully certified with AWS and have a Golden Jacket.

name: Andrei Rusnac
bio: Coming from the Networking and Linux field I am a DevOps engineer who loves spending time discovering new things and troubleshooting infrastructures. I like to research new methods of optimizing products and to find extravagant ways to solve the unsolvable.

name: Andrei-Mihai Zaharia
bio: In 2020, I embarked on my IT journey with almost zero experience, driven by the need to sustain my company. After a few months of hard study, I realized that this is a field I truly enjoy. Over the past four years, I've had the privilege of working as a contractor for renowned companies like Google. Today, I run my own IT company, offering specialized services in infrastructure, CI/CD (DevOps), and cloud solutions. If you're passionate about starting your own journey in IT or need expert advice, feel free to reach out.

name: Andrej Onufrák
bio: I’m a DevOps engineer focused on streamlining software development and deployment by automating key processes. I work on building and managing scalable infrastructure to ensure smooth, efficient operations. My goal is to enhance collaboration, improve system reliability, and accelerate the delivery of high-quality software.

name: Andrej Trusevic
bio: As a Cloud Engineer specializing in Kubernetes, I work on designing and managing secure, scalable and reliable cloud environments. My expertise includes using Kubernetes and other Cloud Native technologies for efficient container orchestration and automation, with a strong focus on security. I am committed to continuous learning, staying updated with industry trends and sharing knowledge with the community in my blog https://sysadminas.eu

name: Andres Arias
bio: I'm a DevOps guy who loves Kubernetes and Cloud technologies, always up for learning something new and tackling tough problems. Troubleshooting is my thing, and I'm looking to dive deeper into cybersecurity and solution architecture.

name: Andres Mujica
bio: Cloud Native & AI/ML Architect, founder of SEAQ, and certified Azure AI Engineer. Andrés trains and consults on AI, Kubernetes, OpenStack, and Automation across LATAM, EU, and the US. Marathoner, lifelong learner, and cat dad to Leia & Luke. He's always chasing the next leap in tech or on foot.

name: Andres Ortega
bio: My name is Andrés Ortega, a Colombian living in Austria. My background is quite different from my current career path: I first earned a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry and Chemical Engineering. Later, I moved to Austria to pursue a master’s degree in Sustainable Energy Systems, which led me to an internship at the Fraunhofer Institute in Kassel. There, I completed my master’s thesis, bridging my earlier academic background with applications in AI. After graduating, I began working as a data analyst, where I became involved in projects that introduced me to DevOps and MLOps. Driven by curiosity and a hands-on learning approach, I built my own local lab environment to deepen my skills. This journey eventually led me to pursue CNCF certifications, culminating in the achievement of the Kubestronaut badge, a milestone that reflects my passion for cloud-native technologies and continuous learning. Whenever possible, I actively participate in the CNCF Cloud Native Linz community, sharing knowledge and learning from peers. Through these experiences, I continue to grow my expertise while contributing to the broader cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Andres Perez Velez
bio: I’m a Senior Technical Specialist at Microsoft. I am passionate about Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. My role is to help customers design and implement cloud-ready architectures.

name: Andrew Aiken
bio: I'm a practicing DevOps and Cloud Security Engineer who works heavily with Kubernetes, infrastructure as code & AWS. I'm a volunteer for the NECCDL (neccdl.org) which sets up cyber defense competitions for college students across the northeast of the USA. Outside of work, I am usually either working on a project, spending time outside, or studying.

name: Andrew Dean
bio: Infinitely curious about all things technology, with a special interest in Cloud, Kubernetes and Container security.

name: Andrew Korolov
bio: Led by common sense, I commit to responsible actions, guarantee transparency in everything, and work hard to achieve a win-win outcome.

name: Andrew Ravn
bio: I'm a DevSecOps leader passionate about building secure, scalable, and developer-friendly platforms using Kubernetes and modern cloud-native tools.

name: Andrew Sutliff
bio: Andrew is an automation fanatic and a lover of Linux. While he specializes in Kubernetes, he also is a tour de force in creating developer platforms for both IaC and App deployments in Azure and Google cloud platforms with GitOps. In his free time, he continues his quest for fluency in Chinese and French, and enjoys creating music on his modular synth and erhu.

name: Andrey Gustavo De Oliveira
bio: I am a Data Platform Engineer, with experience in providing resilient and scalable Big Data and Data Engineering solutions on Kubernetes, using CNCF technologies such as Airflow, Spark and Kafka. I also provide DevOps, SRE, and Security solutions to support a Data Platform on Kubernetes, using CNCF technologies such as Flux, KEDA, Velero, Prometheus, Gatekeeper.

name: Andrey Trapezin
bio: DevOps Engineer with a 4+ years track record in streamlining software development processes and optimizing deployment workflows. Experienced in setting up CI/CD pipelines, maintaining MLOps platforms, and orchestrating releases for diverse IT products. Skilled in communication, collaboration, and leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive efficiency and enhance software quality. Proactive problem-solver dedicated to continuous improvement and innovation.

name: Andrii Berezniuk
bio: Andrii Berezniuk is a DevOps engineer with 10+ years of experience in the industry. He specializes in the development and transformation of cloud-native applications, DevSecOps, and CI/CD implementations, with the focus on scalable and secure solutions to complex business problems. Connect with Andrii on LinkedIn to learn more about his work and insights.

name: Andrius Cibulskis
bio: I am Platform/DevOps/SRE Engineer. Passionate about Kubernetes and all the CNCF technologies since 2017. My journey with technology began in the early days of computing, back when the 286 processor was cutting-edge. Exploring FreeBSD, Linux and the early days of the internet sparked my passion for technology, problem-solving, and innovation.

name: Andrzej Kaczynski
bio: Experienced Cloud Architect passionate about guiding organizations through successful cloud transformations. I'm a huge Kubernetes and CNCF technologies fan, constantly exploring new open-source solutions and sharing knowledge within the community.

name: André Wanlin
bio: André, a full Stack Developer from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, is an active member of the Backstage open source project having contributed 3 plugins - Azure DevOps, DevTools, and Linguist - as well as various features, bug fixes and documentation updates. He's often found on the Backstage Discord Server helping others and sharing his passion for all things Backstage. When he's offline you can catch him at the local dog park with his Frenchton Bailey!

name: Andy Chuang
bio: Andy is a DevOps engineer with a passion for designing cloud architectures and enhancing system observability. He has hands-on experience with public cloud platforms like AWS and GCP, as well as expertise in managing Kubernetes clusters and working with CNCF technologies. Andy focuses on delivering high-performance and stable environments, ensuring that clients' systems run efficiently and reliably.

name: Andy Peng
bio:
PNW local. Seasoned software product builder and technologist based in Seattle (WA). Expertise in large-scale distributed systems and cloud computing: AI, ML + Data, containers & virtualization, serverless compute, open-source. Diverse experience encompassing both people management and technical leadership, including cross-company collaborations. Community Lead of Cloud Native Seattle. Technical advisory board. Guest lecturer of University of Washington. Photographer, Music lover, have a taylor made in walnut, and I love Icewine. Homepage: https://pengandy.com/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be joining the CNCF Ambassador program. As someone who is deeply passionate about building and promoting fundamental technologies, particularly in the realm of Cloud Native solutions, I feel grateful for the opportunity to deepen my connections with the community and share my knowledge and experience with open-source users around the globe. By being part of this program, I hope to make a broader impact and bring even more value to Linux Foundation and CNCF. Additionally, I am eager to learn more about the needs of users and help them understand how they can effectively use cloud native and container technology to solve their problems.

name: Andy Suderman
bio: As CTO, Andy Suderman uses his extensive cloud native and Kubernetes experience to help drive research and development at Fairwinds. He has previously held roles as SRE, Principal Engineer and Director of R&D and Technology. He works with infrastructure spanning all three major clouds as well as verticals from Healthcare to SaaS and Fortune 500 to small business. He is a Co-Chair of the Policy Working Group, as well as the author and maintainer of Goldilocks.

name: Andy Wu
bio: I am deeply invested in the Kubernetes ecosystem, steadily advancing my expertise in this field. With a commitment to continuous learning and practical application, I aim to provide precise and innovative solutions. Embracing the spirit of exploration, I remain eager to uncover new opportunities and push the boundaries of cloud-native technologies.

name: Ang Jian Yu Kenny
bio: A seasoned Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps Engineer with expertise in Terraform, GitLab CI/CD pipelines, and a wide range of AWS services, Kenny is skilled in designing scalable, secure, and cost-optimized cloud solutions. He excels in building reusable infrastructure, automating workflows with Python and Bash, and embedding security best practices into CI/CD pipelines. With extensive hands-on experience in Kubernetes and various observability tools, Kenny is adept at managing and orchestrating microservices while ensuring robust observability and performance monitoring. Recognized for his leadership, mentoring, and commitment to innovation, Kenny consistently delivers reliable and scalable solutions for modern cloud-native applications. He remains dedicated to staying at the forefront of industry trends and emerging technologies, continuously expanding and deepening his skill set. He writes on Medium to share his knowledge and experience. https://medium.com/@kennyangjy

name: Angel Ramirez
bio: Angel Ramirez is an accomplished technology leader and entrepreneur with a strong background in software product development, cloud-native technologies, and Kubernetes Kubestronaut. Angel is a CNCF and TODO OSPO Ambassador, known for his exceptional public speaking skills, effectively communicating intricate technical ideas engagingly and understandably. His dynamic approach seamlessly integrates technology with business strategy, helping organizations achieve robust, scalable solutions while promoting a culture of ongoing learning and community engagement.

name: Angel Yanev
bio: A Senior DevOps Engineer with over eight years of experience architecting and operating resilient, cloud-native environments. Proficient in Kubernetes, Helm, and GitOps-driven CI/CD pipelines, they automate complex deployments to ensure rapid, reliable software delivery. As a passionate advocate for observability, they design and implement end‑to‑end monitoring and logging solutions using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and Datadog.

name: Angelo Cesaro
bio: Experienced Engineer specializing in SRE, DevSecOps, and Platform Engineering with a demonstrated history of working in multiple industries. Ability to balance strong leadership with the creation of collaborative and pleasant working environments. Hands-on, with a proven track record of successful deliveries. Hold all CNCF Kubernetes certifications and all Apache Kafka certifications. Particularly passionate about distributed systems and highly scalable architectures.

name: Anh Nguyen
bio: Having built my career as a Software Engineer, I've always been drawn to the principles and practices of DevOps. I enjoy exploring new tools and technologies through hands-on projects, often experimenting with my homelab setup and tinkering with computer hardware. My passion lies in leveraging cloud-native technologies as part of the ever-evolving CNCF landscape to build efficient and scalable systems.

name: Anh Quach
bio: I am currently working as a Senior DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on cloud-native technologies and CNCF tools such as Kubernetes, Prometheus, and Helm. With a passion for building scalable and resilient infrastructure, I also have hands-on experience in some specific areas, e.g., container orchestration like Kubernetes, microservices, CI/CD pipelines. I will continuously learn new cloud-native technology, and be deeply committed to continuously expanding my knowledge and exploring new advancements within the CNCF landscape.

name: Anh Tuấn Phạm
bio: I am a results-oriented DevOps Engineer with extensive experience in cloud computing, automation, and infrastructure management. Passionate about leveraging modern technologies, I focus on optimizing operations, strengthening security, and improving efficiency. With a solid foundation in Cloud Native Architecture, I remain dedicated to continuous learning and actively contribute to the tech community through open-source projects and knowledge sharing.

name: Aniello Serio
bio: Hi all! I’m Aniello, a passionate advocate for Kubernetes, cloud-native technologies, and the open-source ecosystem. I am deeply committed to promoting the adoption of Kubernetes and CNCF technologies through content sharing, open-source contributions, and active participation in community meetups. I thrive on connecting with like-minded professionals, mentoring fellow enthusiasts, and engaging with the community. My expertise lies in architecting and deploying scalable, reliable, and cloud-agnostic infrastructures and applications that adhere to cloud-native principles, as well as building Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs). I strongly leverage GitOps, DevOps best practices, and open-source solutions whenever possible, while maximizing the potential of the cloud. I am dedicated to driving innovation in cloud-native technologies, contributing to the growth of this vibrant community, and expanding my network with fellow enthusiasts!

name: Aniket Deshmukh
bio: A result-oriented Cloud-DevOps Engineer with expertise in Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, Docker & Terraform.

name: Aniket Kanade
bio: A veteran of tech industry with more than two decades of experience, currently working as DevOps Architect. I've spent most of my tech career in telco industry, while most of my recent work has been in hybrid cloud platform by Azure and on-prem Openshift. Generally, everything kubernetes is my area of ineterest.

name: Anil Yadav
bio: Anil is enthusiast about Open Sources technology and believe in technology for everyone. Working with kubernetes for last 6 years.

name: Anindya Banerjee
bio: I am a Senior Site Reliability Engineer with a deep specialization in AWS, Kubernetes, Observability and FinOps. Over my 14-year career, I have focused on building cost-efficient, compliant, and well-architected solutions that have saved organizations at least $100k annually. I am committed to continuous learning and collaboration within the community, making it a point to connect with peers at KubeCon each year.

name: Anita Ihuman
bio: Anita Ihuman is a developer advocate and community strategist with over 6+ years of experience driving contributions and growth of cloud-native tech and developer communities. Anita is a cloud evangelist promoting the growth and adoption of platform and cloud-native solutions across Africa, serving as an organizer for Kubernetes Community Days (KCD) Nigeria and the CNCF Abuja community group. She serves as a maintainer and Governing Board member at CHAOSS. She also contributes as an advisory board member at OpenUK, a member of the NumFOCUS DISC Committee, and proudly contributes to the DevNetwork Cloud Advisory Board—sharing insights that help shape the future of cloud technology.

name: Aniruddha Hemant Navare
bio: Aniruddha, a seasoned Solution Architect at Persistent System Ltd., has over 25 years of experience in the field. Passionate about cloud-related technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, and Istio, Aniruddha is a die-hard fan of the Linux ecosystem and the Open Source community. With exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to quickly resolve issues, Aniruddha has garnered numerous customer appreciations. Driven by a desire to share knowledge and assist others in achieving their goals, Aniruddha is a passionate advocate for continuous learning and professional growth.

name: Anirudh Pasalapudi
bio: I am a cloud engineer with experience of 12 years. I moved to India from US to stay with my parents and explore opportunities here. I am expert in management and technology at the same time. I have two kids son and a daughter. Outside of work I love to read books.

name: Anish Bista
bio: I’m passionate about cloud native technologies, open source software, and Kubernetes development. I have previously contributed to open-source projects such as KubeVirt and Kanister.io, and currently involved with the CloudNativePG Operator. In addition, I serve as a co-organizer at CNCF Kathmandu and am an active member of DevOpsCloudJunction

name: Ankit Kumar
bio: Ankit is a cloud engineer and developer relations expert with extensive experience in AI and cloud infrastructure, having worked with Fine AI, Xpander AI, Qulifire AI, Myrror Security, and SkyPurple Cloud. A former LFX mentee, CNCF contributor, and Approver in the CNCF Glossary, he has played a key role in open-source ecosystems, driving innovation in cloud-native technologies, orchestration, and microservices. With a deep passion for bridging technology and community, Ankit excels in fostering adoption, delivering impactful technical content, and advocating for scalable AI and cloud solutions.

name: Ankur Gupta
bio: With over 15 years of experience in IT, I began my journey in Linux OS customization and RPM packaging before moving into private cloud technologies like OpenStack and VMware. For the past 8 years, I've specialized in Kubernetes, working extensively with CNCF technologies across enterprise platforms such as Red Hat OpenShift and SUSE Rancher. I currently lead the Container Platform team at HPE, supporting global customers with Kubernetes, DevOps, and cloud-native solutions. To expand my capabilities in AI/ML-native workloads on Kubernetes, I recently completed my Master's in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning from Liverpool John Moores University (LJMU), UK.

name: Ankush Rajinder Pratap Mehta
bio: A K8s enthusiast with a strong Unix/Linux background

name: Anmol Mishra
bio: I am a Data Engineer passionate about building scalable data systems. With a blend of data engineering and cloud-native skills, I excel in crafting efficient pipelines and resilient infrastructure. Continuously learning, I aim to deliver impactful, innovative solutions.

name: Annie Talvasto
bio:
Annie Talvasto is an award-winning international technology speaker & marketing leader. She has been recognised with the CNCF Ambassador & Azure MVP awards. Annie has been a co-organizer of Kubernetes & CNCF Finland meetup since 2017 and has spoken at technology conferences across the world, including KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, Microsoft Build & Ignite, KCDC and NDC. Annie also has hosted Cloud Native Live, a weekly livestream by CNCF, since 2021.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I believe in the positive impact open source technology and CNCF projects have in the world, and I am excited to continue spreading the word about them!

name: Anoop Jayadharan
bio: A Security Consultant with more than 10 years of experience in the industry. I am an open-source enthusiast and cloud-native architect with a deep passion for CNCF technologies. My enthusiasm for Kubernetes runs deep, and I love diving into its complexities.

name: Anqi Wang
bio: As a cloud engineer, I possess a profound passion for container technology. My expertise lies in the successful delivery of on-premises cloud-native solutions, coupled with providing consultancy, troubleshooting and guidance to clients leveraging public cloud container technologies. I take great pride in adhering to industry best practices, ensuring my customer with optimal performance and efficient implementation.

name: Anshuk Kesarwani
bio: I am a Principal Engineer with extensive expertise in Storage ,Networking(Routing & Switching), WAN/application acceleration, Cloud Native Technologies, Kubernetes, and Cloud computing on AWS and Azure. With a strong background in designing and implementing scalable, high-performance solutions, I thrive on solving complex technical challenges. I hold multiple industry certifications from CISCO, PureStorage, LinuxFoundations, Vmware, AWS, Microsoft, Riverbed and Juniper. Passionate about innovation and collaboration, I enjoy working with teams to drive cutting-edge advancements in enterprise technology.

name: Anssi Järvinen
bio: Anssi is an experienced cloud and DevOps professional specializing in Azure, container technologies, and PaaS solutions, with solid skills in Azure networking.

name: Ant Smith
bio: I am a Senior DevOps Engineer at Apple, and specialize in developing and expanding the capabilities of the Apple Online Store. I started in the industry as a Junior Systems Administrator and have overcome many challenges climbing the ladder I work alongside the open-source community to address complex infrastructure challenges on a large scale.

name: Anthony Froissant
bio: I like solving problems, often with code. With over 20 years of programming experience across a wide range of languages and technology stacks, I enjoy exploring new tools and approaches. A lifelong learner at heart, I take pride in earning certifications and achievements that reflect my growth and mastery of a large range of topics.

name: Anthony Macle
bio: I am a DevOps Consultant working for Axians DataBase, where I mainly focus on understanding the challenges of scaling containerized databases. Working hand in hand with DBA's, I strive to provide highly reliable and available environments. This involves optimizing performance and ensuring robust security in dynamic and distributed systems.I chose to specialize in Kubernetes because of its potential to revolutionize container orchestration, offering significant benefits in scalability, flexibility, and efficiency for managing containerized applications while enhancing SLA compliance and optimizing FinOps and Securitiy practices.

name: Antoine Barthelemy
bio: I’m a Linux and Cloud Specialist with expertise in Kubernetes and AWS, focusing on scalable infrastructure, and security, and cost optimization. I’ve worked with startups and scale-ups, leading cloud migrations and implementing DevOps best practices. I actively contribute to open-source projects and explore AI workflows on Kubernetes. Concerned about tomorrow’s challenges, I engage with the CNCF ecosystem and participate in open-research initiatives in marine biology and astronomy. I enjoy working with Rust and Linux.

name: Antoine Guillard
bio: I am a Cloud Security Engineer, specialised in the security implementation in product architecture and/or integration of cybersecurity product in cloud Native Environments. I work on mainly on the the security throughout the lifecycle of a product and broader topics like IAM and PKI. I always heavily rely on open source technologies in my daily work.

name: Antoine Pilon
bio: As a passionate learner, I like to explore new horizons, working towards maximum automation resiliency and scalability. That is obviously why I am working as a DevOps engineer specialized in kubernetes-centered projects. Meanwhile, I do not limit myself to this one and only technology. I am used to working with IaC tools such as Terraform and Ansible, both tools in which I have strong experience. Furthermore, I am curious about everything that is computer-related, from assembly to web development and more... I like to share my knowledge with newcomers, helping them to understand how things work under the hood, and to debate with others experienced people about what is the good way to implement one thing or another. Nevertheless, I am not used to participating in any of the events organized by CNCF, since I am a well anchored stay-at-home living in the countryside.

name: Antoine Planque
bio: Antoine is a Cybersecurity Engineer working at Sopra Steria. He holds a Master's degree in Cybersecurity and is now focused on security in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies.

name: Anton Guba
bio: I love to create and be effective, and technology is where it's possible to implement it gracefully and creatively. Having more than 10 years of experience in various IT fields: from business automation to maintaining high-load systems, I decided to strengthen my knowledge in a great variety of CNCF products.

name: Anton Kobylko
bio: Hello! I have been working in the IT industry for over 15 years and I genuinely love technology. My career encompasses various aspects, from building projects from scratch to software development, which allows me to see the full picture of the industry. I actively keep an eye on new trends and continuously develop my skills to stay at the forefront of technological changes. In my free time, I share my knowledge with friends and colleagues, helping them grow in this dynamic field. I believe that technology can change the world for the better, and I strive to create innovative solutions for real-world problems.

name: Anton Lysenok
bio: I'm a Cloud Infrastructure Manager with over 22 years in IT and 9+ years leading DevOps and SRE teams. As a certified AWS, GCP and Kubernetes expert—and proud Kubestronaut—I specialize in scalable, secure, and cost-effective infrastructure powered by CNCF technologies. I’m passionate about transforming complex systems into streamlined, automated solutions through Infrastructure as Code and cloud-native tooling. I mentor teams, drive innovation, and ensure platform reliability across dynamic environments. Connect with me on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/lysenok

name: Anton Murashka
bio: I'm working as DevOps engineer more than 3+ years. My techonology stack: Clouds; Baremetal; Ansible; Terraform; GitLab; Helm; Kubernetes; Openshift; Istio; ArgoCD; Linstore; Cillium; KubeArmor; OpenTelemetry; Keda. Also interesting in SRE and DevSecOps directions too !

name: Anton Vishnyakov
bio: Ex-software engineer focusing on platform engineering, Kubernetes, security and engineering culture.

name: Antonio Yusta Esplá
bio: I am a Platform Engineer with a strong focus on Kubernetes and Linux. I approach my work with a mindset of innovation, security, and efficiency, and view continuous learning and improvement as essential keystones to both my work and my life.

name: Antony Chen
bio: I am an enthusiastic learner of cloud-native technologies, deeply interested in and curious about the Kubernetes ecosystem. I aspire to continuously explore, implement, and deeply study this field, aiming to master various emerging technologies and gradually accumulate practical skills, so that I can ultimately tackle diverse challenges with flexibility. I am collaborating with my team to develop the Taroko K8s: https://github.com/tarokok8s/Tarokok8s.

name: Antony Patric
bio: Platform Engineer with a passion for Cloud, Kubernetes, and DevOps, blending software development expertise with infrastructure automation to build scalable and resilient systems.

name: António Carvalho
bio: - SRE/Platform Engineer based in Porto/Portugal - Developing and maintaining Kubernetes clusters and other Cloud Native technologies - Focus on GitOps(ArgoCD, Flux), Observability(OpenTelemetry, Grafana Stack)

name: Anurag Kumar
bio:
I'm contributor and maintainer of KubeArmor (A CNCF runtime security project). I'm interested in Kubernetes Security. You can read my blogs here https://kranurag.dev

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be a CNCF ambassador because I'll try to bring and educate more people towards CNCF ecosystem. CNCF is one of the most welcoming community. I also want to share my knowledge when it comes to Kubernetes and other CNCF projects to new peoples who're getting started. Finally, I would love to meet and connect with fellow CNCF ambassadors.

name: Anwar Hassen
bio: Senior Software Engineer (Consultant) providing fast and iterative solutions to complex problems. Main focus on Kubernetes ecosystem ranging from bare-metal to cloud provided flavors. Heavily involved in infrastructure configuration, monitoring, access control and security of Linux based system. Also certified in multiple aspects of the the GCP, AWS and Azure platforms. Proactively involved in learning, knowledge sharing, mentoring and collaboration with others as well as contribute to CNCF open-source projects.

name: Apinant U-Suwantim
bio: As a Software Engineer and cloud enthusiast based in Bangkok, I blend cloud expertise with a passion for emerging technologies. My journey from full-stack development to SaaS cloud solutions reflects my commitment to continuous learning. Proficient in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies, I craft efficient, scalable architectures. I'm dedicated to bridging development and infrastructure, always exploring new tools to enhance cloud computing and containerization solutions.

name: April Kyle Nassi
bio:
April is a seasoned CNCF contributor with hands-on experience in Kubernetes, Istio, Knative, gRPC, and more. At Google's OSPO, she strategically guides projects to the right foundations for success. Passionate about open source in video game development, she manages several of Google's initiatives in this space.

Beyond tech, April is an avid crafter, gamer, and devoted mom to two adorable Australian Shepherds.

name: Arash Haghighat
bio: Tech lead with a broad background across software engineering, infrastructure, and site reliability. I train engineers for CK* certifications and guide them in adopting cloud native practices end-to-end from architecture and platform engineering to observability and operations. I organize the SRE NL Meetup, helping build a strong reliability-focused community in the Netherlands. With hands-on experience across startups, enterprises, and consultancy, I enjoy bridging strategy and execution to drive sustainable technical growth.

name: Areg Hovakimyan
bio: Areg is a DevOps engineer specializing in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. Working with multi-cloud solutions, including AWS and GCP, he use a wide range of CNCF tools daily, with favorites like Argo CD, Falco, OPA, and Crossplane. Focusing on building scalable systems that prioritize security while optimizing performance and resilience, he is passionate about automating processes to enhance infrastructure efficiency.

name: Areum Choi
bio: DevOps Engineer

name: Ariel Jatib
bio: Ariel founded and organizes the New York Kubernetes Meetup. He previously founded Stackpoint.io, an early Kubernetes platform focused on simplifying the process for deploying cloud native stacks at the leading cloud providers. Meet-Up Organizer: New York Kubernetes Meetup

name: Arindam Gustavo Biswas
bio: Arindam Gustavo Biswas is a DevOps Engineer specializing in cloud-native infrastructure. He possesses deep expertise across Kubernetes, Docker, and OpenShift. Arindam masters Linux, CI/CD pipelines, and container orchestration. He also holds a strong passion for API development and testing. Skilled in Python scripting and automation, he is experienced with monitoring, observability tools, message brokers, and distributed systems. With a solid understanding of security practices, Arindam is dedicated to building scalable, resilient, and secure systems that drive enterprise operations forward.

name: Arjun Kaushal

name: Audra Montenegro
bio:
Over the past eleven years, Audra has evolved from organizing global events, to empowering others to do the same, to becoming a speaker herself. For seven of those years, she led programming for both major tech conferences and intimate summits at O’Reilly Media.

Audra’s passion for community building and her expertise in event management have made her a sought-after speaker at conferences such as KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, DevOpsDays, and DevOps World. She has also been a featured speaker at the Open Source Summit, where she shared her insights on the intersection of open source and community engagement.

Since 2022, Audra has served as a Community and Outreach Manager at the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), where she drives global initiatives like Kubernetes Community Days (KCDs), Cloud Native Community Groups (CNCGs), the ChatLoopBackOff (CLBO) livestream series, and CNCF’s member video and streaming programs.

Audra is fueled by a commitment to elevate emerging voices and deepen community engagement. Her passion lies in connecting industry leaders, spotlighting technical innovators, and creating platforms where ideas spark, grow, and resonate globally.

bio:
Passionate, bilingual, creative non-technical community leader who loves being in innovative projects with folks from all over the world and focusing on being inclusive. Leader of CNCF Bilbao Meetup Speaker/Mentor in CNCF Students Co-Organizer KCD Pakistan and KCD Guatemala

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Because I get to do what I love and I love what I do! I love bringing new folks into the CNCF ecosystem so they get to enjoy the amazing experiences and connections I'm so lucky to have as well. Being an ambassador gives me the privilege to highlight the amazing work folks are doing through online/offline events and storytelling.

name: Bartłomiej Kasprzak
bio: DevOps engineer passionate about Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, and cloud technologies. I enjoy building automated, reliable systems.

name: Barun Acharya
bio:
Barun likes hacking on low level stuff and fiddling around developer toolings. He maintains KubeArmor, a CNCF Sandbox project and currently works as a Software Engineer at Accuknox. He loves to talk about Open Source and has been associated with programs like Google Summer of Code and LFX Mentorship. Find his blogs at https://barun.cc

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF Ambassador has heightened my enthusiasm to further promote, educate, and support the cloud-native community. Leveraging my prior experience as a speaker and maintainer, I am now even better positioned to advocate for and strengthen the ecosystem through advocacy and knowledge sharing.

name: Batbayar Narantsogt
bio: I'm a Senior DevOps Engineer with expertise in cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes and CI/CD automation. I focus on building scalable, reliable infrastructure and stay actively engaged with the DevOps and CNCF community.

name: Batuhan Apaydın
bio:
Batuhan Apaydın a.k.a. developer-guy has been very active in the Software Supply Chain Security space. He is eager to learn more about it in all aspects because he knows this topic will become one of the utmost critical topics that everybody has to be concerned about. Towards that direction, he won the “Best Sigstore Evangelist” award and wrote a blog post about it to encourage to the next one and took an active role in the first-ever SigstoreCon by being one of the Program Committee members of the event and created a Twitter Community about Software Supply Chain Security and that community is now about 500+ people joined. He is also selected as Docker Captain Program 2023. In addition to that he is also a CDF (Continuous Delivery Foundation) Ambassador 2023. He also tries to be active in Turkey by organizing in-person, and virtual meetups, and workshops. He is the organizer of two important organizations in Turkey named DevOpsTr, CNCF Istanbul Chapter, and Cloud Native Turkiye. He is also one of the organizers of the KCD Turkey. He is also an active contributor to several CNCF projects including Ko, Flux, and Kyverno. He also enjoys writing technical blog posts and wrote 10+ blog posts and all of which are published on important official websites including Kyverno, CD Foundation, Flux, Sigstore, etc. • https://cd.foundation/blog/2022/10/18/tekton-chains/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/10/prove-the-authenticity-of-oci-artifacts/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/08/manage-kyverno-policies-as-ocirepositories/ • https://fluxcd.io/blog/2022/11/verify-the-integrity-of-the-helm-charts-stored-as-oci-artifacts-before-reconciling-them-with-flux/ • https://kubesimplify.com/the-secret-gems-behind-building-container-images-enter-buildkit-and-docker-buildx • https://blog.kubesimplify.com/getting-started-with-ko-a-fast-container-image-builder-for-your-go-applications • https://nirmata.com/securing_base_images/ • https://blog.sigstore.dev/how-to-verify-container-images-with-kyverno-using-kms-cosign-and-workload-identity-1e07d2b85061

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: First of all, I'm the first person from Turkey who has been selected as a CNCF Ambassador which is super great for me because I have the energy to spread all my knowledge with other people and I do really like to collaborate with people by organizing in-person, virtual meetups. I thought that I can waste my time and energy by becoming a CNCF Ambassador still continue organizing meetups and sharing knowledge because Turkiye has great potential of using CNCF projects to solve problems.

name: Baturay Ozcan
bio: I’m a Senior DevOps Engineer with nearly 10 years of experience, starting my journey in System Administration before moving into the world of DevOps and Cloud. The first four years of my career were spent managing mission-critical trading systems—on-call for over 3.5 years. That early exposure taught me the real meaning of observability, uptime, and operational excellence. For the past 5 years, I’ve worked globally as a Cloud and DevOps Consultant, helping teams architect scalable, secure, and automated infrastructures—mostly on AWS. I hold both the AWS Solutions Architect Professional and DevOps Engineer Professional certifications. I specialize in: • Designing resilient CI/CD pipelines • Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Terragrunt) • Kubernetes (I recently earned the CNCF “Kubestronaut” badge for completing all 5 Kubernetes certifications: CKA, CKAD, CKS, KCNA, KCSA) • DevSecOps, observability, GitOps, and scalable cloud-native systems

name: Baudrin Tanguy
bio: Staff Engineer actually working for Sfeir, talking occasionally on Sfeir Lunch meetup. Writer at Sfeir.dev. I'm also giving trainings around Cloud Technologies.

name: Beatrice Forslund
bio: DevOps Engineer. Interested in Kubernetes, as well as GitOps tools such as ArgoCD.

name: Behrouz Arji
bio: Behrouz is Senior DevOps Engineer with extensive experience in implementing DevSecOps and SRE practices by designing secure and scalable innovative solutions in large-scale distributed systems and cloud computing.

name: Belhedi Chaima
bio: Hi, I’m Chaima! I’m deeply passionate about infrastructure, cloud-native technologies, and everything that powers modern platforms. I discovered this passion the day I realized I could spend hours debugging—driven by patience, curiosity, and genuine love for the craft. When the Kubeastronaut program was announced, I made it a personal mission to be part of it—and I’m proud to say: goal achieved. I’m especially drawn to Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, cloud automation, security, and the ever-evolving cloud ecosystem. I love building reliable, scalable systems and finding joy in the small details that make big things work. Currently, I’m a Platform Engineer at InstaDeep, where collaboration, growth, and lifting each other up are at the heart of what we do. I’m incredibly grateful to the mentors and teammates who’ve supported, challenged, and believed in me—your guidance has shaped my journey. If there’s any way I can help, contribute, or even exchange knowledge—don’t hesitate to reach out. I’m always happy to share, support, and keep learning—together.

name: Ben De Haan
bio: I am a Security/DevOps Consultant, Trainer and Engineer, and co-project leader of OWASP WrongSecrets. My specialties are architecting and implementing cloud native services and building secure CI/CD environments. I enjoy public speaking and hosting trainings or workshops, and I’m an OWASP NL Meetup regular.

name: Ben Kooijman
bio: I am a cloud engineer doing DevSecOps work as a consultant in the south of Sweden. Apart from being absolutely obsessed with computers I also love running, cooking and playing video games.

name: Ben Somogyi
bio:
Ben is a Senior Staff DevSecOps engineer at Lockheed Martin, where he spearheads the development of innovative cloud-native platform architectures. With over a decade of experience in the Cloud Native landscape, Ben has established himself as a trusted expert in leveraging cutting-edge tools and technologies to drive business results in both commercial and public sectors. Before joining Lockheed Martin, Ben held key roles as a Principal Platform engineer and consultant at various commercial companies, where he refined his expertise in cloud-native technologies and developed a passion for delivering high-impact solutions.

As a Technical Lead at Lockheed Martin, Ben is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining a Kubernetes-based cloud-native platform that empowers all of the company's business areas to deliver exceptional value to a growing customer base. He holds a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Florida and a Master's degree in Computer Science from Colorado State University, providing a strong foundation for his technical expertise.

Outside of work, Ben values spending time with his family, including his wife and two children, in the beautiful state of Colorado. When he's not working, you can find him mountain biking, exploring the outdoors, or enjoying the many recreational activities that Colorado has to offer.

name: Benjamin Boerner
bio: I am a system engineer, installing and maintaining Kubernetes clusters primarily in airgapped environments.

name: Benjamin Calvet
bio: I am an IT Engineer with a background in Linux SysAdmin, I transitioned to (the dark side) software development and became fascinated with tools like Kubernetes and Cloud Native tech. I specialize in implementing containerized architectures using DevOps practices to help businesses accelerate their deliveries. Over time, I've become a true fan of Kubernetes, attending numerous Kubecons and even speaking at DevOpsDays Geneva about its 10-year history. My innate curiosity drives me to constantly learn about new technologies and best practices about them. As a CNCF enthusiast, I really like sharing my knowledge and experiences with others to help them navigate the ever-evolving tech landscape.

name: Benjamin Einaudi
bio: Backend developper, I am quite interrested in any subjects related to containerization, such as development environment setting, continuous delivery, deployment orchestration.

name: Benjamin Muschko
bio:
Benjamin Muschko is a software engineer, consultant, and trainer with more than 20 years of experience in the industry. He specializes in cloud-native application development and transformation, container solutions, DevSecOps, and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery implementations. Ben is an author, a frequent speaker at conferences, and an avid open source advocate. Among his published books are the Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) Study Guide, the Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) Study Guide, and the Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS) Study Guide.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to teach beginners the basics of Kubernetes in a practical and relatable fashion. One way to learn Kubernetes effectively is by following the curriculum of the official Kubernetes certification exams. I will continue to produce hands-on learning resources in the form of written, and interactive media.

name: Benny Hoog
bio: Kubernetes enthousiast, cloud developer, and Linux engineer. Aiming to build better full stack applications to make everyone's life a whole lot easier.

name: Benson Lam
bio: I have been working for project implementation over ten years, playing engineer, specialist and architect role. Currently focusing on cloud native adoption and system integration.

name: Beomseok Kim

My core competencies encompass architecting, deploying, and refining DevOps methodologies across diverse cloud infrastructures such as Azure, AWS, and GCP. I excel in dynamic, agile settings and consistently deliver durable solutions that elevate the software development lifecycle and deployment workflows.

name: Berk Berker
bio: With over 20 years of hands-on software development experience, I have spent decades building robust, scalable, and user-focused applications. After transitioning into the world of DevOps, it isn’t just a career shift, it’s a journey into the cloud-native environments, ensuring smoother pipelines, faster releases, and more robust systems. I am always eager to explore new technologies and stay updated with the latest trends.

Additionally I'm one of the operators of the "home-operations" Discord community where like-minded people hang out and discuss. Feel free to join us :)

bio: I am passionate about open-source technologies, especially cloud-native applications, and I am eager to engage in all aspects that support and mentor newcomers in the field. I am also committed to continuous learning and professional development.

As a committed continuous learner, I thrive on mentoring teams and delivering secure, scalable, cloud-native solutions that drive business impact.

Passionate about tech and a jack of all trades, I love learning and sharing on a variety of topics, especially at French conferences such as Devoxx FR, Sunny Tech, and Volcamp...

She likes to hang out at the intersection of enterprise software, open source and developer tools, and enjoys a good selfie with the community.

name: Bhanu Theja Pasam
bio: I’ve been working in the fields of Devops and cloud technologies for the past 10 years

With a robust background in .NET Core microservices development and performance consulting, I have a proven track record of delivering reliable, scalable, and secure solutions across diverse domains, including legal, tax, banking, and insurance. I hold multiple certifications in Kubernetes, AWS, and Istio, underscoring my commitment to continuous learning and excellence in cloud-native technologies. Passionate about fostering collaborative environments, I actively mentor cross-functional teams and am always eager to tackle new challenges in DevOps, SRE, cloud computing, open-source technologies, and AI.

I’ve earned the "Kubestronaut" badge, showcasing my deep expertise in Kubernetes. Beyond DevOps, I also work with Java (Spring Boot), TypeScript, Go, and Rust, building backend systems, web apps, and command-line tools. Always exploring new technologies and sharing insights, I enjoy solving real-world challenges in cloud automation and system architecture.

name: Bhavani Indukuri
bio: CNCF. She possesses extensive expertise in optimising Release processes and DevOps methodologies at Zscaler. In her previous role at Servicenow, Bhavani spearheaded a team in migrating infrastructure to Kubernetes, skilfully managing microservice deployments, Kubernetes application backup and monitoring. Recognised as a prominent speaker at conferences, Bhavani is passionate about enlightening audiences on the transformative potential of DevOps and CNCF Projects. Through her involvement with Women in CNCF, she orchestrates workshops focused on CNCF projects and advocates for increased female representation in the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Bijoy Paul

I love collaborating with others, sharing what I learn, and contributing to communities that help people succeed with cloud-native tech.

My main areas of expertise include Kubernetes, containerization, and Linux systems in modern infrastructure environments.

In this role, he is for responsible for using open source to build industrial ecosystems, expand industrial spaces, and build a healthy and harmonious industrial environment.

name: Bingi Narasimha Karthik

His contributions support better cloud-native decision-making, and he’s been an active speaker at KCD and KubeCon events.

name: Birger Myhrvold

I strongly believe in continuous learning and have a breadth of expertise in cloud platforms and cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes, Istio, Cilium, Kyverno, OpenTelemetry & Prometheus.

name: Blake Shaver

I am interested in cloud technologies and containers and push myself to learn new tools to implement new solutions. I also hold certifications in Linux, Ansible, AWS, Jenkins and Terraform.

name: Bmk Lakshminarayanan
bio:
Transformation Architect, SECTION6 BMK is an inspiring and passionate DevOps Advocate and Value Stream Architect promoting DevOps, Lean and Value Stream Management principles & practices. He is also a New Zealand ambassador for the Cloud-Native Computing Foundation(CNCF), DevOps Institute and a Board Advisor for the Value Stream Management consortium(VSMC). He hosts the CNCF meetup in Wellington, New Zealand and is co-chair of Cloud-Native Summit A/NZ. He blogs about his experiences and learnings at https://bmk.nz/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: 1. Promoting Open Source and Cloud-Native projects and ecosystem tools in our community. 2. Connecting with experts, maintainers, contributors and other Opensource and cloud-native thought leaders to amplify my learning 3. Use the ambassador program and help in bringing in the best to my community in terms of cloud-native learnings, education and training.

name: Bo Liu

I act as a critical escalation point for Azure customers during production incidents, driving rapid mitigation and enhancing root cause analysis. By proactively identifying customer pain points, I uncover product gaps and collaborate closely with engineering teams to drive improvements.

name: Bob Killen
bio: Bob Killen is a Senior Technical Program Manager focusing on improving CNCF project governance processes and finding engaging ways to bring end users and maintainers together. He serves the Kubernetes project as a Steering Committee member and is a recently retired Contributor Experience Special Interest Group chair. Before joining the CNCF, Bob was a program manager at Google's Open Source Programs Office, where he guided and developed strategies for Google's open source projects. Bob has a history of bringing cloud and HPC/AI/ML together and is passionate about Academic Outreach. He is also an outspoken advocate of Open Source, Open Science, and pets of the furry 4-legged variety.

name: Bogdan Sass

I have worked as a consultant on many enterprise projects, and I thrive mostly as a system, platform and security architect.

He was honored with the José Gualberto Pérez Award for excellence in physics and mathematics and is passionate about continuous learning.

As a manager of an infrastructure DevOps team, I have got familiar with Kubernetes as one of our main cloud native focus areas. My interests also include Argo, Envoy and Istio.

name: Brad Mccoy

Brad is originally from New Zealand now working in Australia as the Head of Platform Engineering, he has been involved in the DevOps space for a long time now and serves as a board member of the Continuous Delivery Foundation. Brad is a maintainer of the Keptn project and works on the Kubernetes Release team. And is involved in mentoring in GSoC projects. His favorite projects to work on from the CNCF are GitOps, Security and Observability projects. He is helping to organize the KCD Australia and also runs a meetup in Australia.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador to further help and mentor other folks coming into the cloud native space and guide them in the right direction. I'm also excited because I can continue working on the outreach of the CNCF and show organizations how they can contribute and help grow the projects and unlock innovation.

name: Bradley Andersen

name: Brandt Keller
bio: Passionate about Open Source, mentorship, and community building through engagement with diverse groups and perspectives. Member of TAG Security and multiple CNCF working groups. Currently specializing in cloud native policy and compliance.

I advocate for CI/CD (continuous integration and continuous delivery) and emphasize security by design, reinforced by continuous scanning.

name: Bret Fisher
bio:
For 25 years, I've built and operated distributed systems and helped over a million people learn dev and ops topics. I'm also a Docker Captain and the creator of the wildly popular Docker & Kubernetes Mastery series on Udemy. I provide DevOps-style consulting, workshops, a popular DevOps Discord server, a container-focused YouTube channel, and a podcast. I basically spend my days helping people and giving high fives.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I think DevOps culture and container tech have changed the IT Pro and Developer world forever! For over eight years, I've been a megaphone for container tech and love teaching cloud native DevOps topics. The CNCF community has been a great experience for me both as a teacher and a learner, and I want to make sure it's great for many years to come.

I am part of EMEA Telco Architect's team, solving complex problems, and adapting to new technologies to deliver innovative and impactful solutions for Telco Cloud requirements.
