I am highly driven by the challenge of staying ahead of emerging technologies and finding efficient solutions to complex technical problems. I am also certified as AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate and Certified OpenStack Administrator.

name: Byungjun Kim
bio: I'm a DevOps Engineer. I'm so happy to be Kubestronaut. I love Kubernetes and CNCF projects. I wish CNCF endless development. and I run a tech blog with more than 600,000 total visitors, so please love it a lot. tech blog - https://kingofbackend.tistory.com

name: Bálint József Jánvári
bio: I was bored and I wanted the jacket.

name: Bálint Kaszás
bio: I started as an intern at NTT Data (then still Dimension Data), where I dealt with network and data center virtualization. In addition, I wrote small applications in python and script languages, which helped clients perform various integrations efficiently. I really like to discover and learn new things, which is why I came to Kubernetes, which contains an inexhaustible number of integrations and components.

name: Cahit Yusuf Kafadar
bio: As a passionate consultant specializing in cloud-native technologies, I have a wealth of experience in designing and optimizing modern cloud solutions. My work focuses on empowering organizations to enhance their agility, scalability, and operational efficiency through cutting-edge cloud-native practices. With a strong dedication to innovation, I strive to deliver tailored solutions that align with the unique goals of every business I collaborate with.

name: Cailyn Edwards
bio:
Cailyn is a Senior Infrastructure Security Engineer, with a passion for Kubernetes and the open source world. She is an active contributor to Kubernetes SIG-Security, SIG-CLI and a 2022 Kubernetes Contributor Award recipient. Her current focus is on network, and Kubernetes multi-tenancy security and she gets to spend her working hours contributing up stream. It brings her great joy to spend time with the CNCF community and empower folks to become involved. Outside of work Cailyn can be found running, playing squash, walking her dogs or working in the garden.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am *so* excited to be a CNCF ambassador because this community has been incredibly impactful to my growth in the industry and I want to give back. I cannot wait to help share all the wonderful things happening at CNCF and organize events for members new and old. One of my favourite parts of my job is mentoring, and I look forward to being able to do this in the Cloud Native community! I want to ensure that each new member has the same welcoming and positive experience that I did!

.

name: Calexx Chimanyiwa
bio: I am a seasoned DevOps professional with a robust background in networking, DevOps practices, and cloud computing. Holding a Bachelor of Engineering Honors degree in Electronic Engineering, I have amassed several industry certifications, including all five Kubernetes certifications, HashiCorp Certified Terraform Associate, and various AWS certifications including AWS DevOps professional. My expertise spans across networking, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS and Terraform. Passionate about continuous learning and innovation, I excel in creating efficient, scalable, and secure DevOps pipelines, solving complex challenges, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

name: Caliendo Julien
bio: I began my career in the military, where I developed a strong foundation in discipline and problem-solving under pressure. After transitioning into tech, I worked as a software developer before specializing in Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), where I focus on building resilient, scalable systems. I have a growing interest in CNCF technologies like Kubernetes, Prometheus, and many others tools, and enjoy sharing knowledge with the community. I occasionally speak at local meetups and contribute to open-source projects when possible.
location: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France

name: Calum Murray
bio: I'm a Knative Eventing Maintainer and UX Working Group Lead. I co-founded the University of Toronto Open Source Students, where I help university students contribute to open source projects, such as Knative and CloudEvents.

name: Camila Soares Camara
bio: Camila is a platform engineer with experience in Cloud and DevOps, working with technologies such as kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS and Infrastructure as Code (IaC), always focusing on implementing scalable and secure solutions to improve the end user experience.

name: Carl Castanier
bio: With a scientific background in physics and data analysis, I apply a structured, analytical approach to building cloud-native platforms. Passionate about Kubernetes, open source, and IaC, I design automated, resilient, and scalable infrastructures with a strong business focus and empathy — crafting elegant solutions that meet real needs. I’m driven by real-world impact, tech challenges, and the power of collaborative engineering.

name: Carl Stuart
bio: A jack of all trades with a strong and proven background in software development, automation and cloud migration.

name: Carla Gaggini
bio:
Carla has been managing events and communities since 2011. She started with experimental music festivals and eventually ended up in Tech, where she fell in love with its ecosystem. During her career she has produced and run many conferences (yes, also the virtual ones!), meetups, webinars and hackathons. Formerly at Container Solutions managing everything "WTF is Cloud Native" and "Software Circus", she currently buzzes around Cilium and eBPF at Isovalent. She is also one of the organisers of KCD UK, a CNCF and OpenUK Ambassador, and the 2022 CNCF Marketing Committee Chair. Carla drinks way too much tea (mainly green), has an unhealthy obsession for Japan and a big passion for art, music, cinema, philosophy and fashion. Recent blogs: https://blog.container-solutions.com/why-your-event-needs-a-code-of-conduct-and-you-need-to-enforce-it https://blog.container-solutions.com/how-hard-is-it-to-deliver-a-virtual-conference https://blog.container-solutions.com/tech-events-in-the-time-of-covid-19-5-tips-to-survive

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: This is an invaluable opportunity to support the CNCF and the Cloud Native community. I'm incredibly excited to help new joiners and spread more awareness around all the initiatives they can embrace within the CNCF, the various KCDs and the Cloud ecosystem in general.

name: Carlos Aguni
bio: I'm an SRE with a Master's degree in Computer Engineering in HPC. I'm always keen on honing my abilities in cloud computing, distributed systems and observability. I'm passionate about technology and love exploring new skills as an eternal apprentice.

name: Carlos Encarnacion
bio: Hello, my name is Carlos Encarnación. I am an engineer passionate about innovation and emerging technologies. Throughout my career, I have gained extensive knowledge and experience, and my greatest aspiration is to continue growing and exploring within this fascinating field. Embracing new challenges in this domain is, without a doubt, my passion and my preferred pursuit.

name: Carlos Omar Ravelo Alvarez
bio: With over a decade of experience architecting robust IBM integration solutions, I possess a deep understanding of connecting complex enterprise systems. My expertise spans the full implementation lifecycle, from API design and security to DevOps automation and monitoring. I am now applying these skills to build and support scalable, cloud-native applications within the Kubernetes ecosystem.

name: Carlos Sancho
bio: Software Engineer and Tech Lead at Redshift Global, with over 10 years of experience. With a strong focus on Kubernetes, security and Cloud Native approach.

name: Carlos Santana
bio:
Carlos Santana is a Senior Specialist Solutions Architect at AWS leading Container solutions in the Worldwide Application Modernization GTM team. He is experienced in distributed application architecture, emerging technologies, open source, serverless, gitops, devops. He is a contributor to CNCF projects such as Kubernetes and Knative. Find him on Twitter @csantanapr or his Kubernetes Bookclub https://santana.dev

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to work with the CNCF, and be able to help the CNCF to improve on how it works and get perceive by the community of contributors and consumer of cloud native tech. I'm excited to meet new folks and be able to collaborate on projects on enablement of projects such as Kubernetes.

name: Carmelo San Giovanni
bio: As a Staff Engineer at Security Compass and Kubestronaut, I use Kubernetes to automate away operational toil, drive the adoption of best-in-class tools, and streamline the developer experience, ultimately creating platforms that accelerate release cycles and improve our security posture. My focus is on building infrastructure so seamless it fades into the background, allowing developers to innovate freely while trusting in resilient, self-healing systems. I believe the pursuit of mastery demands constant adaptability, and I actively share that journey by mentoring my team on emerging cloud-native technologies.

name: Carolina Valencia
bio:
Carol is an enthusiastic software developer focused on the practices of secure cloud native. She collaborates in open-source projects and contributes to the Kubernetes project. Currently residing in Sao Paulo, Brazil and collaborates with local events. In her free time, she enjoys running, playing beach tennis and watching history documentaries.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: - The opportunity to establish meaningful relationships with like-minded individuals who are interested in shared knowledge - Contributing to the community by sharing knowledge and announcements inside my local area and social media, to help us to develop ourselves. - Learning and growing together with the community, leveraging the collective knowledge and experiences of its members to foster personal development.

name: Carsten Sónyi
bio: After being a system engineer for a few years I switched over to the bright DevOps-side of IT. I am driven by a love for elegant and simple solutions for complex problems, and I am always eager to learn more about CNCF technologies.

name: Casper Thygesen
bio: Casper is a consultant and solution architect with solid experience in technologies such Kubernetes, Strimzi and Opensearch. He has built several platforms over the decades in AWS, Azure and pure cloud-native platforms as well.

name: Cathy Zhang
bio: Cathy is a Principal Engineer at Confluent. She has over 20 years of software design and development experience in a wide range of areas such as serverless, large scale distributed VM/container orchestration and scheduling, edge computing, container runtime, service mesh, software defined network, and high availability etc. Cathy has been an active contributor in the cloud-native computing ecosystems including Kubernetes, OpenStack, OPNFV, and has led the development of several open-source projects under CNCF, Linux Foundation Networking, Linux Foundation Edge and Open Infrastructure. She has made strong contributions to the technical direction and design, driving working group discussion, and resolving technical disagreements. She co-authored the CNCF serverless whitepaper, the CloudEvents specification, and the OpenStack service function chaining design. She has served as the program committee member/track chair for several Kubecons and OpenStack summits. She has delivered talks at various open-source conferences (Kubecon, OpenStack Summit, Open Source Summit, OPNFV).

name: Cedric  Kouogang
bio: I’m just a DevOps/SRE engineer passionate about tech who like learning new technologies, playing with them and running them in production, if possible.

name: Celalettin Altinpinar
bio: I have been doing Cloud and Container Orchestrations projects for long time, helping customer to adopt new technologies and transform their legacy applications and environment to cloud-native technologies. I am Red Hat Certified Architect for 6 years and doing events for container technologies, container security and Devops. I am also managing Cloud and DevOps team.

name: Celia Stamps
bio: Celia is a Senior Manager of Events at The Linux Foundation, bringing over 20 years of experience in the hospitality and events industry. With a proven track record of managing everything from high-profile social events to large-scale tech conferences, she plays a pivotal role in executing impactful events for The Linux Foundation’s collaborative projects. Celia holds a Bachelor of Science in International Hotel & Tourism Management from Johnson & Wales University and is passionate about delivering seamless event experiences that foster innovation and connection.

name: Cemal Yıldırım Dalar
bio:
Entrepreneur | co-founder gittigidiyor.com | Kubestranaut | Cloud Architect ☁️

I'm a Cloud Native Engineer and Kubestronaut based in Amsterdam, and co-founder and former CTO of GittiGidiyor.com (acquired by eBay). With deep experience in building scalable platforms, I now focus on Kubernetes and CNCF technologies to help teams deploy and manage modern infrastructure. I'm passionate about open-source, automation, and mentoring the next generation of engineers.

name: Cenk Caglar
bio: With over two decades of industry experience, I currently serve as an App Innovation Cloud Solutions Architect within the Healthcare and Life Sciences team in the Customer Success Unit at Microsoft. I have been globally honored as a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) four times. My contributions include publishing four software books, delivering numerous seminars, and extensively teaching software development courses. I am passionate about utilizing and contributing to the open-source community. I hold a degree in Management of Technology from New York University.

name: Cenk Odabaşı
bio: I’m a DevOps Engineer with over 5 years of experience in Kubernetes, cloud platforms, and CNCF technologies. My focus is on building secure, scalable, and reliable cloud-native systems, with a strong interest in container orchestration and DevSecOps practices. As a Kubestronaut, I enjoy exploring emerging CNCF projects and contributing to the cloud-native community.

name: Cezary Stanisławski
bio: DevOps Engineer since 2022, I'm passionate about building infrastructure that doesn't page me at 3 AM. I enjoy the challenge of taming large-scale systems and seek to improve infrastructure resilience and operational efficiency, one YAML file at a time.

name: Chabane Refes
bio: Hey! I've been a Cloud Architect & Software Engineer for around 13 years already. I've worked for diverse product companies and also consultancies. I have a passion for exploring topics such as technology, sociology, biology and even leadership. I also hold a passion for Container, DevOps and Security and I love bringing these principles to my customers by empowering them with the power of the public cloud.

name: Chad Beaudin
bio:
Chad is the Chief Engineer for the Boeing Software Factory and a Technical Fellow. In these roles he drives the technical vision for how software is developed by thousands of engineers utilizing cloud native methodologies in a variety of highly regulated environments. As a DevOps enthusiast, he promotes the sharing of best practices around CI/CD.

When not working, Chad is an avid mountain biker.

name: Chad M. Crowell
bio:
Chad is a Principal SRE at Akamai, and author of the book "Acing the Certified Kubernetes Administrator Exam". Chad has been an instructor for over six years on platforms such as A Cloud Guru (now Pluralsight) and INE. Through KubeSkills, he helps people find fun and interactive ways to learn Kubernetes, Linux, and containers.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I really enjoy helping people get involved in open source software. I have realized the power of community, in lifting others up and succeeding together, and I love to share it with others. I believe it is my duty in life to share what I've learned in order to make intellectual progress as a human race.

name: Chai Chee Hwee
bio: He began as a Java Paladin, slinging object-oriented spells until he multiclassed into DevOps Druidry and Platform Engineering, mastering CI/CD incantations. After vanquishing YAML wraiths in the Kubernetes labyrinth, he emerged a certified Kubestronaut—kubectl is his trusty weapon, carving order from cluster chaos. Join his party—if your node is ready.

name: Chaiwat Dechanukulkit
bio: I'm a Cloud Engineer passionate about cloud-native technologies, with expertise in Linux/Unix-based OS, AWS, Kubernetes, and automation

name: Chamila De Alwis
bio: I'm a Senior Cloud Architect with experience in Software Engineering, DevOps, and SRE in past lives. As an Open Source Software enthusiast, I love writing niche tools and use them to tinker with my home lab. I also blog at https://chamila.dev

name: Chamod Perera
bio:
Chamod Shehanka Perera serves as a Software Engineer and is a passionate advocate for open source and cloud-native technologies. He has a keen interest in delivering tech talks on subjects like open source and cloud technologies. Notably, he has taken on leadership roles for KCD Sri Lanka 2022 and KCD Sri Lanka 2023, alongside his dedicated team. Presently, he leads various communities, including Kubernetes Sri Lanka, GDG Sri Lanka, and GitHub Community Sri Lanka, while he’s also fully experienced on building cloud native CI/CD platform when worked at WSO2. He shares his insights and experiences related to software development on his blog, accessible at https://chamodshehanka.medium.com. Furthermore, he has successfully implemented a solution for Database Scaling on Kubernetes as part of his undergraduate research, which has been published as a paper (https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9671185). In his leisure time, Chamod Shehanka Perera is an avid practitioner of karate, holding a 2nd-degree black belt, and enjoys spending time at the gym and surfing on weekends.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador because it allows me to continue what I'm doing, giving back to the community and contributing to CNCF projects. Additionally, the role offers the opportunity to network with new people, fostering connections with like-minded individuals. As an ambassador, I look forward to sharing knowledge and ideas, enabling us all to stay updated on the latest developments in this rapidly-evolving field.

name: Champ P.
bio: Champ is a dynamic Platform Engineer, proficient in Kubernetes migrations and CI/CD implementation. His expertise spans the full development cycle, from distributed systems to mobile applications, and he is well-versed in various programming languages. He has a keen interest in cloud-native projects such as Argo, Tekton, and Cilium. A DevSecOps advocate, Champ prioritizes security in every development phase, delivering robust and secure systems.

name: Chandrasekhar Malladi
bio: I am a Senior Platform Engineer with extensive experience in the CNCF landscape, particularly with Kubernetes, ArgoCD, and their extensions. I have architected and implemented large-scale cloud-native solutions, focusing on delivering scalable and highly available systems. My deep expertise in Kubernetes and other CNCF tools drives my passion for continuous learning and innovation within the cloud-native ecosystem. I am actively expanding my knowledge to further enhance automation and infrastructure in cloud-native environments.

name: Charles Haugh
bio: I love playing with bleeding edge technologies. I run a bare-metal openstack cluster at home and a bare-metal k8s cluster. Other than nerding out, I like to go for bike rides on the boardwalk.

name: Charles Lee
bio: Curretnly I'm working in the Fortinet as senior devops engineer.

name: Charlie Boon
bio: I’m a Cloud Engineer with 5+ years of experience working across cloud platforms and DevOps practices. I love building CI/CD pipelines, automating infrastructure with IaC, and helping others grow their skills along the way. Certified in Azure, AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, GitHub and more, I’m always curious and keen to learn new things. My passion is making cloud solutions simple, efficient, and useful for real people.

name: Chase Christensen
bio:
Chase Christensen is a Principal Customer Engineer at Wiz, where he helps organizations secure cloud-native and ML workloads. His journey into MLOps began through the Kubeflow community, where he went on to chair both the 2025 Kubeflow Summit in Atlanta (https://colocatedeventsna2025.sched.com/event/28FLh/kubeflow-summit-welcome-+-opening-remarks-kubeflow-summit-a-community-big-enough-for-everyone-chase-christensen-wiz)

and the Kubeflow Virtual Symposium (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t0vfJY267f0&list=PLj6h78yzYM2MCEJPmVgUZsEx7lFjqh8BC&index=5). Along the way, he authored the Linux Foundation’s Introduction to AI/ML Toolkits with Kubeflow course, helping practitioners bridge Kubernetes expertise with machine learning practice. Chase also founded the Applied Machine Learning Collective of the Rockies (https://amlcoftherockies.org/), a Denver-based community focused on advancing hands-on AI/ML collaboration. He shares his thoughts on MLOps and open-source adoption as a contributor to the Evil Tux blog (https://eviltux.com/2025/06/17/the-kubeflow-blog-series/).

name: Chay Te
bio: Chay IT background goes from Linux administrator to platform engineer for more than 24 years. He worked for various domain, insurance, bank, public services, telecom, agri-food, pharmaceutical, watchmaking helping people with his passion about automation and containerisation in linux ecosystem as a senior consultant, trainer and coach. He founds so much fun working in the DevOps area and he likes to share this fun whenever possible.

name: Chee Kit Tang
bio: Hi, I'm Chee Kit, a Software Engineer on the AI Platform team, passionate about driving innovation at the intersection of artificial intelligence and cloud-native technologies. I love working with cutting-edge tech to create reliable, intelligent systems that drive value. I'm excited to keep learning and contributing in the dynamic world of AI and cloud-native platforms.

name: Cheng Feng
bio: Starting my journey as a backend engineer, I quickly found myself drawn to the world of infrastructure, automation, and developer experience. That curiosity sparked a transition into DevOps, where I now work as a Senior DevOps Engineer at Apple Inc., helping power the scale and reliability of the Apple Online Store.

name: Cheng-Xi Yang
bio: I am passionate about Cloud Native, DevOps, and GitOps technologies. I enjoy working with tools such as Kubernetes, Jenkins, Argo Workflows, and Argo CD to build effective CI/CD pipelines. I am collaborating with my team to develop the Taroko K8s: https://github.com/tarokok8s/Tarokok8s.

name: Chenghao Yang
bio: ChengHao is a co-organizer of the Cloud Native Taiwan User Group (CNTUG), assisting in organizing monthly meetups and guiding new community members to contribute. He is interested in exploring each CNCF project and regularly helps resolve issues. Occasionally, he writes technical articles on Kubernetes/CNCF on his blog. Feel free to visit!
company: Wizigo Inc. (SRE engineer) / Tzu Chi University (Graduate Student)

name: Cher Don Liew
bio: Cher Don is a Senior DevOps Engineer at Salesforce Singapore with deep expertise in Kubernetes and cloud-native infrastructure. He specializes in platform engineering and release automation, leveraging technologies such as Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Temporal, and Spinnaker to build highly available and secure microservice platforms. Outside of work, he enjoys creating passion projects including algorithmic trading platforms and end-to-end automation pipelines for personal and marketing use. He also organizes internal study groups and local CNCF-related meetups in Singapore, where he shares hands-on experience in Kubernetes security, GitOps, and self-hosted automation (e.g., n8n and home-lab clusters). Cher Don documents his technical deep dives and runbooks on Confluence and occasionally blogs at cherdon.dev and Medium about DevOps tooling and cloud-native architectures.

name: Chiara Salvatore
bio: I'm a cloud-native enthusiast with a career spanning over 17 years in solution and IT architecture, systems, DevOps and platform engineering, building strong expertise across the stack, from data centres and cloud infrastructure to containers and applications.

name: Chima Agwuncha
bio: I am a self-motivated professional based in Budapest, with expertise in Telecoms, multi-Cloud, Cybersecurity, and IT. I hold certifications in Cloud, Linux and Kubernetes

name: Chimbu Chinnadurai
bio: Chimbu is a passionate senior cloud architect with a knack for solving complex cloud challenges.He has a proven track record of helping companies of all sizes leverage the power of Kubernetes and achieve greater scalability, agility, and resilience.He actively shares his expertise through insightful blog posts on his Medium page (https://chimbu.medium.com/) and by engaging with the Open Source and Cloud Native communities at industry conferences.

name: Chng Shen Jie
bio: Guardian of the New Frontier. Interested in Solution Architecting, DevSecOps and Platform Engineering.

name: Chris Abraham
bio: Chris is a PMP-certified technology leader with a consistent record leading high-performing software teams. He has managed projects for clients such as Samsung and MetLife in addition to distributed blockchain development teams like the Aragon DAC. Chris has been developing mobile and web applications for over 20 years and has been working with CNCF since May 2018. He holds a Systems Design Engineering degree from the University of Waterloo.

name: Chris Aniszczyk
bio: Chris brings more than 15 years experience as The Linux Foundation’s vice president of Developer Programs. His work is focused on working with developer community to advance open source projects at scale. Previously Chris served as Twitter's head of open source, where he led a team of developer advocates and was responsible for Twitter's open source engineering, strategy and culture. He has also contributed to Gentoo Linux and served on the Eclipse Foundation's Board of Directors and the Java Community Process Executive Committee. An engineer by trade, Chris brings a passion for both open source and community development to the organization.

name: Chris Burns
bio: Open-source enthusiast, wearer of many hats, but at the core - an engineer, with a specific interest in building platforms, applications and securing the software supply chain. Chris has played almost every core engineering role there is, from software engineering to platform engineering, all the way to architecting and team leading, Chris prides himself in being able to lead the way in many disciplines, but what really drives him is problem solving on the frontier.

name: Chris Doyle
bio: A DevOps Engineer / SRE who enjoys the cloud native ecosystem. A fan of observability, and contributing to open source projects.

name: Chris Finn
bio: Senior DevOps Engineer with a solid foundation in application development. I have a keen interest in all things Kubernetes, with a specific focus on observability and resource optimisation. Using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps), and GitOps tools (Flux CD) to apply DevOps best practices and develop cloud-native platforms for enterprise environments. I also contribute as an author and subject matter expert in delivering internal Kubernetes training. Microsoft Certified: DevOps Engineer Expert.

name: Chris Jaimon
bio: Code whisperer by day, YAML exorcist by night — this developer lives and breathes Kubernetes, occasionally dreaming in Helm charts. As a die-hard fan of all things Cloud Native, I believe containers are the new black and "kubectl apply" is a lifestyle choice. From fine-tuning autoscalers with Karpenter to taming sidecars with Istio, I treat Cloud Native like an art form. When not debugging pods, I'm probably evangelizing service meshes to unsuspecting coffee shop patrons :)

name: Chris Mazur
bio:
I'm a software/devops engineer with a strong vocation for tech communities. I founded a few conferences including Cloud Native Summit / Service Mesh Day / ScaleConf NZ / FullStack Day / PHP New Zealand / Connecta.dev / Auckland Cloud Native Meetup, Wellington Devops Meetup and more... and I Co-Founded PHP Conference Argentina. My goal is helping to connect the Software Development Community in the Southern Hemisphere. Originally from Argentina, my family and I moved to New Zealand more than 10 years ago, where we still live today, in the beautiful city of Wellington.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: First of all, receiving recognition from the CNCF is an honour and a great support to continue working for the local tech community. It is definitely a great opportunity to open new doors and offer more opportunities to our community and I am very much looking forward to working with many other colleagues and friends in this ambassador program. Thanks!

name: Chris Old
bio: Chris has been in the IT industry for over 15 years and has found a special interest in Kubernetes and Container technology. Now working as a Platform Engineer across a number of projects and helps teams to manage their Microservice Deployments on container platforms such as Openshift and EKS. Chris has a keen interest in Kubernetes cluster monitoring, application observability and metrics, and helping teams secure their applications with Kubernetes best practices.

name: Chris Short
bio: Chris Short has been a proponent of open source solutions throughout his 20+ years in various IT disciplines, including systems, security, networks, DevOps management, and cloud native advocacy across the public and private sectors. He currently works as a Developer Advocate at Amazon Web Services, and is an active Kubernetes contributor. Chris is a disabled US Air Force veteran living with his wife and son in Metro Detroit. Chris writes about Cloud Native, DevOps, and other topics at ChrisShort.net.

name: Chris Werner Rau
bio: I'm a k8s loving DevOps Engineer focusing on GitOps and automation using flux, helm and more. I run the Kotlin Usergroup Bielefeld and also co-run the Kubernetes Meetup Bielefeld as well.

name: Christian Alday Lacsina
bio: Christian is a hobbyist at heart that tries to share his experience and passion in Kubernetes (and other tools!) with as many students as he can. He takes on the toil of learning tools, techniques, and their nuances and shares them back to whomever is willing to listen and give him time in the classroom. The small stockpile of computers (consumer- and server-grade) and his high electric bill are a testament to his dedication to making sure people learn well in the time they get with him.

name: Christian Boon
bio: I am a programmer / DevOps engineer based in Capelle aan den IJssel, the Netherlands. I am very passionate about Kubernetes and learning new technologies. I really enjoyed studying for the 5 CNCF exams to be come Kubestronaut. I love reading science books, go running outside and traveling.

name: Christian Colic
bio: I am a passionate DevOps Engineer with a strong background in automation. Always eager to expand my knowledge, I'm constantly seeking to learn new technologies and improve my skills. With expertise in networking, Linux, automation, cybersecurity, and virtualization, I excel at quickly understanding problems and implementing innovative solutions and streamlining processes

name: Christian Gilles
bio: Learning Kubeflow made me dig deep into Kubernetes. I am always eager to learn new technologies in data science, cloud and security. The CNCF Landscape is therefore like a land of milk and honey for me.

name: Christian Huth
bio: I have worked as a Cloud & DevOps Engineer as well as Cloud Architect and Consultant in the healthcare, medical informatics, medical technology and tourism sectors. My focus is on Automation, GitOps, Kubernetes and Monitoring. Sharing my knowledge is my Passion. Therefore I hold Trainings on Kubernetes and write articles on my Blog about Cloud Native Technologies.

name: Christian Pönisch
bio: I'm an experienced Platform Engineer with a strong foundation in software development and system architecture, focused on improving the developer experience by evolving our internal developer platform, which enables the stream-aligned teams to deliver high-quality software solutions to our customers swiftly and efficently. My work involves designing and managing Kubernetes clusters, enabling GitOps-based workflows for infrastructure and application deployments, and driving automation in all DevOps phases. As such, I enjoy taking on new challenges and sharing the knowledge I've gained from exploring interesting CNCF projects and their communities.

name: Christian Zambrano
bio: I am a Multicloud(AWS/GCP) Certified Software Architect with 20 years of experience designing, creating and supporting Highly Available event-driven applications. I have a passion for helping teams realize all the benefits Cloud Native technology provides. I currently run bi-weekly employer-internal Cloud Meetups to help make connections, educate and stay up to date on the constantly evolving Cloud Native landscape.

name: Christina Andonov
bio: I am a Solutions Architect at AWS where I help organization adopt Kubernetes at scale. The two areas I focus on are Platform Engineering and Data on Kubernetes.

name: Christoph Blecker
bio: Christoph is an Architect and Senior Principal Site Reliability Engineer at Red Hat, and Chairs the Cloud Native Computing Foundation Governing Board. He is an active maintainer of the Kubernetes project and an emeritus member of the Kubernetes Steering Committee. If he's not reviewing PRs, he is probably walking his dog.

name: Christoph Kleinhans
bio: Christoph is a Kubernetes enthusiast who has built platforms for large enterprises. He’s now working on a startup for paperless living and with passion at entalys.eu , where he helps organizations design secure and scalable cloud platforms.

name: Christoph Linse
bio: I am running kubernetes/openshift at several customers in Switzerland . I visit Cncf meetups in Switzerland. I have many years experience with devops/gitops and software development.

name: Christophe Calvet
bio: Christophe Calvet is a technical architect specialized in virtualization technologies, currently expanding into Kubernetes and cloud-native solutions.

name: Christophe Kamphaus
bio: I’m an experienced DevOps Architect with extensive knowledge in modern Cloud Native technologies and heterogenous deployments. Adept at deep diving into complex issues I can develop innovative answers to them. Contributing to OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions I help advance the field of CI/CD. A strong communicator I’m dedicated to empowering colleagues and clients through effective and efficient solutions.
company: Centre commun de la sécurité sociale

name: Christophe Sauthier
bio:
Christophe leads the training and certification programs for the CNCF.

In his role, he makes sure that the courses, training and certifications offered by the CNCF are following and reflecting the fast evolving Cloud Native ecosystem.

Christophe is a seasoned Open Source veteran with more than 20 years of experience acting both in the community (Ubuntu, OpenStack, Cloud Native…) and professional services.

He started and lead « Objectif Libre » a successful French company that was delivering services and trainings (35% of their activities) on Open Source technologies (mainly Cloud Native and OpenStack). He is also the co-creator of CloudKitty, the rating component of OpenStack. Following acquisitions, he then worked for Linkbynet and Accenture.

Living in Montreal but originally from France, he enjoys spending time with his wife and kids to discover their new region. He can also be found around basketball courts, his other great passion.
company: Cloud Native Training and Certifications Lead

name: Christopher Adigun
bio:
As a Cloud Native Telco Architect, I specialize in designing telecommunications networks using Kubernetes and related software.

My expertise includes advanced Kubernetes networking solutions like Multus, Whereabouts, SRIOV-Device-Plugin, Spider-Pool, and Userplane Acceleration (DPDK).

I'm passionate about sharing my knowledge and have created a Udemy course on Kubernetes networking (https://www.udemy.com/course/kubernetes-baremetal-networking-using-gns3).

Additionally, I create content about Kubernetes-related topics on my Medium blog (https://medium.com/@futuredon) and YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAdwhfPswT1hDezzRGnTKg)

name: Christopher Duffy
bio: Chris, or know to his friends and coworkers as Duffy, is a dedicated architect who helps businesses seamlessly migrate and optimize their operations in the cloud. Passionate about CNCF technologies, CI/CD, containerization, and orchestration, he leverages these tools to transform systems for increased scalability and agility. A lifelong learner, Duffy constantly experiments with and adopts cutting-edge technologies, ensuring his clients' cloud journeys remain future-proof.

name: Christopher Hanson
bio: I have taught hundreds of DevOps engineers at Fortune 100 companies how to successfully use Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift, Prometheus, Istio, Spinnaker and other cloud-native tooling to package, deploy, and orchestrate microservice applications at scale. I give frequent talks at industry conferences to share my expertise with the community and write technical blogs with the RX-M team at https://rx-m.com/blog/.
company: RX-M Cloud Native & AI Consulting and Training

name: Christopher Jachetti
bio: Christopher Jachetti is a passionate cybersecurity professional with over 20 industry certifications, including the CISSP, AWS Solutions Architect Professional, and many more. He discovered his calling in cloud security early on and has been immersed in the IT world since high school, continuously evolving his expertise to protect modern infrastructures. As a CNCF Kubestronaut, Christopher embodies a relentless drive for constant learning and improvement. He is committed to empowering organizations and individuals alike, sharing his insights and best practices to push the boundaries of DevSecOps innovation.

name: Christopher Tineo
bio: I’m a Cloud Native enthusiast and a firm believer in the value this ecosystem brings to the software industry in LATAM. I lead the Santo Domingo chapter, where we’re bridging the gap between Cloud Native and Open Source technologies in the Dominican Republic. Through sharing my journey and knowledge on LinkedIn and community events

name: Christos Markou
bio: Software Engineer with main focus on observability and cloud native technologies. Eagerly working on OpenTelemetry project as an active contributor (and area specific approver) with the ambitious goal of making it the next generation Observability standard. Interested in everything around infrastructure, Kubernetes and containers. Cloud Native Athens chapter co-organizer.

name: Chung Ng
bio: A passionate DevOps engineer, dedicated to optimizing software delivery through open-source technologies and platform engineering. Enjoyed collaborating with teams to enhance deployment processes and drive innovation. Enthused in cloud native software architecture design

name: Claudio Domingos
bio: With over 15 years in IT, I specialize in aligning architecture, operations, and security with industry best practices. My focus is on automation, cloud infrastructure, and DevSecOps to help clients build secure, efficient, and reliable systems. I value clear communication, practical solutions, and continuous improvement. Always open to sharing ideas and learning from others — let’s connect!

name: Claudiu Avatamanitei
bio: I am an experienced IT professional with a strong background in design and implementation of complex software platforms, reliability and observability engineering, and defense in depth security. I am currently focused on enabling digital and cloud-native transformations at scale in the mortgage servicing business, by providing harmonious foundational technology ecosystems composed of vendor neutral, CNCF managed open source de facto standards. With extensive hands on expertise in Kubernetes (EKS, OCP), Istio, GitOps and ArgoCD, OTEL and Kiali, IaC (Terraform, Crossplane, Spacelift, Puppet), software development (Python, Java, C++), and several CI/CD platforms, I enable teams to focus on business value delivery and ensure low stress, successful development and operations of comprehensive software platforms.

name: Clay Lu
bio: I am a continuous learner with most of my experience in AWS and some experience in data engineering. I am also very interested in Kubernetes, ArgoCD, and Istio.

name: Clement Phu
bio:
I’m currently a DevOps Engineer @ Capgemini mainly focused on creating and running Kubernetes Clusters On-Prem.

Willing to work on CNCF projects, I’m interested in GitOps, Helm and security.

name: Clyde Fondop
bio: Senior DevSecOps professional with a background in application security and penetration testing. Passionate about security, with experience working in London, UK, and Toronto, Canada. Possesses extensive expertise in DevOps, assisting developers in implementing secure coding practices.

name: Cláudio Da Silva Pinheiro Júnior
bio: I am a DevOps and Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with extensive experience in designing and maintaining scalable and secure infrastructure on Kubernetes, leveraging CNCF technologies such as ArgoCD, Crossplane, and Prometheus. I specialize in Infrastructure as Code (IaC), GitOps, and cloud-native solutions, working across platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP, and Oracle Cloud. My expertise extends to managing Kubernetes clusters (EKS, AKS, GKE, and more), automating deployment pipelines, and ensuring high availability and disaster recovery strategies.

name: Cody Galloway
bio: Cody is an Event Manager with a focus on Content at The Linux Foundation, and manages the speakers and content for KubeCon + CloudNativeCon events. Prior to joining The Linux Foundation, Cody brings over six years in the event industry and has assisted planners in over one hundred corporate events.

name: Colin Tan
bio: Hi. I’m Colin, a DevOps engineer at GovTech. I love all things cloud native.

name: Corentin Ghyselinck
bio: I’m a DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on Kubernetes and cloud-native infrastructure. I’m deeply driven by continuous learning, especially by learning from others through collaboration and real-world experience. I believe knowledge grows when it’s shared, and I thrive on helping others grow alongside me while building reliable, scalable systems. I’m also passionate about guiding teams and shaping long-term strategies for cloud-native platforms. 🌬️ Born in France's kite capital 🎮 Always platinum my games, that probably explains a few things

name: Cornelis Stuurman
bio: I am a Cloud Native/DevOps engineer that likes diving into bigger problems and finding out of the box solutions. I love learning about new tools and concepts in the Cloud Native Landscape, and am currently working towards the Golden Kubestronaut Certification!

name: Cortney Nickerson
bio: Open source and cloud native lover by day, sleep deprived mom by night. I'm a non-techie turned techie who is still learning about the CNCF Landscape. I love contributing to community projects, connecting with others, and learning all I can along the way. I work for Nirmata, the creators of Kyverno as Head of Community. I also have experience in DevRel, Solutions Engineering, and a array of non-tech roles to boot. I help organize the CNCF Bilbao Community Meetup and various KCD events. Additionally, I advocate for kindness, support for people transitioning to a career in tech -- especially women, DEI, BIPOC, and work-life balance for all parents in this space.

name: Cosmas Nyairo
bio: I am a DevOps Engineer with experience in cloud migration, containerization, configuration of CI/CD pipelines, GitOps, infrastructure as code and scripting.

name: Cosme Cabello
bio: I'm a DevOps engineer with a background in Applied Computer Engineering, based in Chile. Passionate about Kubernetes, CI/CD, and cloud-native security. Currently exploring Cilium, eBPF, and observability tools.

name: Craig Box
bio:
Craig is Senior Director of Developer Relations at cloud-native application networking company Solo.io, and a Steering Committee member for the Istio project.

Prior to Solo, Craig had a number of roles at Google, including leading Google's participation in Istio, Head of GTM launching GKE, and leader of the Cloud Native developer relations team, responsible for Kubernetes, GKE and Anthos. He was the founder and co-host of the Kubernetes Podcast from Google, producing the top 20 show for over four years.

Craig has worked with Cloud Native customers and communities since the launch of Kubernetes in 2014, and has delivered talks on 6 continents, including a KubeCon keynote. He started his career when DevOps was called ‘systems administration’, and has 20 years of experience in development, deployment, DevOps, consulting, advisory and management roles around the world.

name: Cristher Castro
bio:
Cristher Castro, co-founder and COO of Cuemby, is a visionary leader and operational dynamo who drives community building in the Latam tech scene. Over the last 3 years, she advocated for the adoption of open-source technologies within the Spanish-speaking community, creating and supporting tech meetups and events in the region. She co-created, along with her team, the first Kubernetes Community Days in Colombia. This event paved the way for the expansion of Cloud Native Groups throughout the region. Cristher's foresight and operational expertise have been fundamental to the success of both Cuemby and the Cloud Native Latam Group. Recognizing the region's need for in-depth knowledge of cloud-native applications, Cristher championed the LFS250 (Linux Foundation Course) and administered the KCNA certifications donated by CNCF to the region. These two initiatives heightened awareness of cloud-native technologies and certifications, fortifying local proficiency in open-source solutions. She continues to promote and advocate for the recognition of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) in the region, addressing both business and community aspects. Cristher's leadership and operational prowess exemplify her unwavering commitment to fostering a thriving Latam tech community. https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-latin-america/ https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-medellin/ https://www.cncf.io/reports/kcd-colombia-2023/ https://www.cuemby.com/about-us https://www.linkedin.com/company/fundaci%C3%B3n-hispana-de-cloud-native/?viewAsMember=true https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-colombia/ https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/kcd-colombia/?viewAsMember=truehttps://www.linkedin.com/showcase/kcd-colombia

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF ambassador empowers me to further my dedication to community growth in the LATAM region. I deeply believe that the region's success hinges on the symbiotic collaboration of professionals, students, and companies. It's this harmony that forms the core of my mission: to cultivate a thriving community ecosystem centered around open-source and cloud-native technologies. Through this role, I am positioned to amplify awareness about these technologies and the transformative opportunities they introduce. My operational and logistics expertise is set to facilitate more meetups and events, thus kindling the formation of new communities. Collaborating with fellow leaders and ambassadors provides a unique platform to unite our efforts, ensuring we collectively advance our shared vision.

name: Cristian Alloggio
bio:
I am Cristian, DevOps Engineer, Solution Architect and a passionate advocate of technology innovation with a strong focus on DevOps technologies and best practices.

What started as curiosity turned into passion... and now it's a mission!

I am always curious to learn new technologies related to the cloud ecosystem, especially containerization. I actively participate in the local technology community, sharing insights and experiences through collaborative projects and knowledge sharing sessions.

name: Cristian Daniel Bayona
bio: Multicloud Cloud native apps deployment and security specialist. The events that I normally attend as speaker are app security ones AppWorld, CyberProtector and Segurinfo

name: Cristian Musat
bio: I'm an Enterprise Architect and experienced Java developer with a strong focus on cloud-native technologies and CNCF tools. I specialize in designing scalable Kubernetes-based architectures, implementing GitOps workflows, and building secure microservices using tools like ArgoCD, Helm, and Prometheus. I actively engage with the cloud-native community and continuously explore emerging technologies to enhance enterprise systems.

name: Cristo Fernando Abadia Lopez
bio: I’m a seasoned Site Reliability Engineer and DevOps Consultant with over 10 years of experience in building and operating infrastructure for high-traffic systems. I’ve worked across startups and enterprise environments, helping teams improve reliability, automate operations, and scale with confidence. My approach combines technical depth with a strong focus on collaboration and mentoring. I’m passionate about creating systems that empower people and simplify complexity.

name: Cristobal Nevares
bio: While relatively new to the DevOps profession, I have found a deep passion for all things Kubernetes and Cloud Native technologies with a focus on security, reliability, and cost optimization.

name: Cédric Moulard
bio: With over 25 years of experience in the tech industry, I have transitioned from software development to tech leadership at a prominent French cloud provider. My expertise spans software development and infrastructure management, with a strong focus on Kubernetes. I am passionate about cloud-native technologies and committed to driving innovation in the cloud ecosystem. Eager to contribute my extensive knowledge and leadership to the CNCF community.

name: Daan Van Den Udenhout
bio: Devops engineering who loves to learn new things about Kubernetes and the CNCF technologies

name: Daekwang Ryu
bio: I am Daekwang Ryu from Korea do for a MSA work. I am interested in working with people from all over the world.

name: Dag Bjerre Andersen
bio: I’m a Senior Platform Engineer with a strong focus on GitOps. I enjoy working with cloud native technologies and have experience building Kubernetes platforms in both startups and larger organizations. I try to speak at conferences whenever I get the chance, often blending real code examples with storytelling from the field.

name: Dahun Kang
bio:
I'm a SW engineer working primarily with cloud native technology.

In the past, I developed backend applications. However, In choosing the best option from the options given to me, I'm doing something different from the career I started. I feel lucky to be working with cloud native technology and hope to see many new and exciting things in the future.

name: Daiki Hayakawa
bio: I contribute to Kubernetes SIG Docs as the Japanese localization owner within the CNCF community, and I am also an individual contributor to Kubernetes, Kubernetes CSI, and various Kubernetes SIGs. I serve as an organizer for study groups targeted at beginners, mainly covering cloud-native technologies centered around Kubernetes (https://k8s-novice-jp.connpass.com/). Additionally, I co-host broadcasts with friends on YouTube, where we share updates and news about cloud-native tools (https://www.youtube.com/@KubernetesInternal). When I give presentations, I often share findings from my research into the internal implementations of Kubernetes and its related repositories (https://speakerdeck.com/bells17).

name: Daiki Takasao
bio: I'm a Japanese IT infrastructure engineer working at NRI. I work with CNCF technologies in building financial IT systems. I have been using Kubernetes, Linkerd, and Prometheus for many years and have sufficient know-how.

name: Damian Igbe
bio: Damian Igbe, PhD, has a doctorate in computer science. He is a Technical trainer and consultant with Cloud Technology Experts, Inc. Damian Loves helping and simplifying cloud native technologies for organizations, worldwide. Damian runs one of the largest Kubernetes meetups in Dallas, the Kubernetes and Cloud-native North Dallas. Damian loves running and has completed several marathon races.

name: Damian Sztankowski
bio: Senior Cloud Solution Architect with a passion of helping people. Raised at on-prems, actually playing with clouds. Google Developer Expert in Google Cloud.

name: Damian Szuberski
bio: Damian is an accomplished senior DevOps/SRE engineer renowned for designing and implementing secure, scalable solutions for large-scale distributed systems in the cloud. His expertise spans Cloud Native, Kubernetes, GitOps, Service Meshes, CI/CD, Serverless, and Observability.

name: Damien Jacinto
bio: I am a freelance cloud-native engineer and trainer based in France

name: Damien Obringer
bio: Damien is an experienced Solutions Architect currently working at PwC Luxembourg. He is passionate about designing and implementing scalable, highly available, and maintainable applications using .NET, Kubernetes, Helm, and other Cloud-Native technologies.

name: Damilola
bio: Cloud Computing Professional specializing in Kubernetes and container orchestration. Avid interests in traveling, chess, boxing, real estate and finance.

name: Damon Wright
bio: Senior platform engineer at Capgemini.

name: Dan Farrall
bio: Lead Platform Engineer @ Capgemini. Dan has extensive experience in technical architecture and cloud solutions, specializing in designing and implementing scalable, resilient infrastructure that drives business transformation. With 10+ years of experience across energy, healthcare, and public sector organisations, he brings a wealth of industry knowledge to engagements. Dan is highly certified, posessing a broad range of technical prowess allowing him to bridge traditional domain boundaries and drive cross-functional teams in a leadership capacity. 27x Microsoft Certified | Kubestronaut | DevSecOps | Terraform | AWS SA | CCNA | VCP

name: Dan Oliver
bio: Dan is a Technical Architect with extensive experience in developing software and cloud solutions for Financial Services, Automotive, and Retail sectors. Transitioning from a software development background into cloud-native DevOps and platform engineering, Dan is proficient with AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes, and keen to get stuck into code, driving innovation and efficiency in his field by creating valuable solutions.

name: Dandan Liang
bio: Dandan is an associate professor in Pengcheng Laboratory and has more than ten years of experience in the field of communication technology. Her current research area is cloud native network technology.

name: Dandi Shi
bio: I'm Dandi Shi, a Support Escalation engineer in Microsoft with over 5 years of hands-on experience in Kubernetes. I'm passionate about container orchestration, cloud-native technologies, and Linux systems. I thrive on solving complex infrastructure challenges and continuously exploring ways to optimize and automate deployments. Whether it's building scalable clusters or fine-tuning system performance, I enjoy diving deep into the tech that powers modern applications.

name: Dang Nguyen
bio: I am Dang, a Cloud Engineer. I love video games.

name: Dang Trung Nghia
bio: I'm a Site Reliability Engineer with a passion for cloud-native tech and building reliable, scalable systems. As a Kubestronaut, I focus on Kubernetes, observability, and automation, ensuring systems are both resilient and efficient. I enjoy researching and implementing new technologies to meet evolving business needs, often translating complex requirements into effective technical solutions.

name: Daniel Anghel
bio: I began my career as an Automation Engineer in 2018, but my curiosity soon led me to explore how data moves across networks — a topic that quickly became a passion. I was deeply intrigued by cloud technologies and how it transforms the way systems operate. Running my first containerized application in Docker was a turning point that sparked a strong interest in Kubernetes, which I’ve since been eager to understand in depth. Today, I work as a DevOps Engineer, combining my love for automation, cloud infrastructure, and container orchestration. Outside of work, I enjoy running homelabs on old refurbished hardware, always looking for new ways to learn and experiment.

name: Daniel Bodky
bio: Daniel is a Platform Advocate from Germany with a strong interest in Kubernetes, Automation, and Homelabbing. He sometimes writes about these topics on his blog https://dbodky.me, or talks about them at conferences and meetups. He loves connecting people in the cloud-native space and helps organizing Kuberoke, a series of Karaoke events for the cloud-native community.

name: Daniel Bronk
bio: Hi! I’m Daniel Bronk, a Cloud Engineer and Kubernetes expert living in Utrecht, Netherlands. I love to closely collaborate within a team to create, discuss and complete projects in the best possible way. My main focus is maintaining Kubernetes clusters, automating the process and creating the cloud infrastructure needed to run the applications on these clusters.

name: Daniel Chuang
bio: I consider myself a beginner in cloud-native, but with strong enthusiasm for Kubernetes and its related technologies. Through the journey of becoming a Kubestronaut, I have built a solid foundation and continue to strengthen my skills. In this fast-evolving cloud-native ecosystem, I aspire to keep learning with passion, improve my technical expertise, and contribute to the community.
company: National Taiwan University of Science and Technology (Graduate Student)

name: Daniel Czerwinski
bio: Cloud Devops Engineer at Rackspace. Interested in all things Kubernetes, as well as GitOps tools like helm/fluxCD.

name: Daniel Céspedes
bio: I'm a security professional passionate about technology and customer success, dedicated to architecting solutions that drive real impact. I thrive on engaging in technical discussions, helping customers navigate challenges, and showcasing innovative solutions. With a hands-on approach, I stay in the field, bridging the gap between security, technology, and business needs to ensure long-term success.

name: Daniel D M
bio: Meet a Cloud Architect who writes code with the enthusiasm of a kid in a candy store. Armed with coffee and an insatiable appetite for automation, I transform mundane tasks into elegant solutions while Kubernetes keeps me humble with its delightful complexities. As a devoted servant of Jesus Christ, I approach technology with the same dedication as my faith. When not wrestling with cloud infrastructure, you'll find me exploring new technologies and tools, always curious to learn what's next in the tech world. I embrace a minimalist lifestyle, finding joy in simplicity both in code and in life. My love affair with Kubernetes stems from its beautiful chaos - where community-driven solutions tackle real-world problems head-on. Like a digital shepherd, I guide applications through the cloud, learning and growing alongside an amazing community of problem solvers. Think of me as your friendly neighbourhood automation enthusiast, fueled by coffee and powered by faith, always ready to transform complex challenges into elegant solutions. Because in the end, technology is not just about code - it's about building bridges and growing together. Life's journey isn't just about conquering technical challenges; it's about leaving footprints of kindness and knowledge for others to follow. After all, the greatest legacy we can leave behind is not in the systems we build, but in the lives we touch through sharing and caring. Personal Blog: https://bookofdaniel.in/

name: Daniel Dias
bio: Daniel Nunes Dias is a highly skilled Cybersecurity Specialist with over five years of dedicated experience in the cybersecurity field. Holding prestigious certifications such as a CISSP, CCSP, and CCSK, Daniel brings a robust expertise in cloud security, Kubernetes, and Azure to his work. Known for his ability to tackle complex security challenges, he is passionate about leveraging automation to streamline operations and enhance security practices.

name: Daniel Drack
bio: I'm Daniel Drack, a DevOps engineer and community organizer from Graz, Austria. I work as a cloud-native consultant, teach at an Austrian university of applied sciences, and currently run the local CNCF chapter in Graz. Additionally, I'm one of the founders of Cloud Native Austria, the association hosting KCD Austria. I love speaking at conferences and meetups, solving technical challenges, and being part of the cloud-native community.

name: Daniel Hawton
bio: Daniel is a Sr Software Developer at Solo.io with a focus in DevOps, and a maintainer with the Istio project. Prior to Solo, I was apart of SUSE Rancher.

name: Daniel Izevbije
bio: Daniel is a technology enthusiast whose journey spans from deep research in blockchain to mastering modern cloud technologies. Driven by a passion for continuous learning and collaboration, he excels as a strong team player committed to innovation and growth.

name: Daniel Kofler
bio: I'm a Linux enthusiast and network engineer with a strong passion for DevOps and automation as well as containers. I enjoy designing and implementing scalable, reliable systems that streamline operations and improve efficiency. I'm also deeply interested in data analytics and monitoring, using insights to optimize performance and ensure network stability.

name: Daniel Krook
bio:
Daniel Krook is focused on better serving the maintainers, contributors, and users in the community of 200+ open source projects hosted by the CNCF. He has been involved in the use, creation, and advocacy of open source technology for over 20 years. He partnered with the LF to establish the "Call for Code with The Linux Foundation" umbrella and has guided 16 projects through the process of joining the LF and using LFX tools.

He has built software end-to-end for a wide array of industries and earned certifications in cloud architecture, application development, and system operations along the way. Most recently, he worked at IBM as a principal engineer developing first-of-a-kind solutions that integrate open source technologies with commercial products and services.

Daniel has spoken at many open source conferences (including main-stage presentations at the first CloudNativeDay and the first KubeCon run by the CNCF), hosted dozens of meetups (primarily OpenWhisk, Cloud Foundry, OpenStack, and PHP), and has contributed to many technical blogs, videos, podcasts, articles, and books.

name: Daniel Lo Man Hok
bio: I'm an infrastructure architect, proficient in designing scalable solutions using Infrastructure as Code (IaaC), cloud technologies, Kubernetes, and server storage platforms. I am passionate about continuously learning and architecting robust, innovative platforms, delivering a profound sense of professional accomplishment.

name: Daniel Mccracken
bio: I am a DevOps and business professional with over two decades of experience spanning enterprise healthcare IT, application development, CI/CD, and Kubernetes administration. I helped found the Google Developers Group of Grand Rapids, MI, which sparked my interest in containerization and orchestration at scale. In 2019, I left the corporate world to help start DevsOperative, Inc. with my friends. They introduced me to Kubernetes around the time of the Kubernetes 1.0 launch, which inspired me to learn and invest in this amazing platform and community. My favorite tools are Helm, ArgoCD, and Cert Manager. Reach out to me on LinkedIn and checkout our stream on Twitch or YouTube called the Cloud Native Coffee Hour!

name: Daniel Nachtrub
bio: Deeply interested in secure cloud native technologies as well as computer engineering core technologies like networking. Kubernetes is one of my preferred technologies, as well as many other CNCF projects. Active blogger at https://blog.nuvotex.de

name: Daniel Oh
bio:
Daniel Oh is Java Champion and Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat. He works to evangelize building cloud-native microservices and serverless functions with cloud-native runtimes to developers. He also continues to contribute to various open-source cloud projects and ecosystems as a Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) ambassador for accelerating DevOps adoption in enterprises. Daniel also speaks at technical seminars, workshops, and meetups to elaborate on new emerging technologies for enterprise developers, SREs, platform engineers, and DevOps teams.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It will give me more opportunities to meet more technical folks who want to adopt/learn new cloud-native technologies and tools. Also, the ambassador makes me a more proactive person to evangelize non-tech people in terms of how/why they move forward to the cloud.

name: Daniel Risnes Dagfinrud
bio: I am a platform engineer from Norway. Working with Kubernetes and working with open source is my passion. I created and am currently maintaining https://github.com/deggja/netfetch

name: Daniel Serrão
bio: I am an IT professional with over 10 years of experience, including 3 years as a Software Engineer and more than 7 years in Site Reliability, DevOps, and Platform Engineering roles. My expertise includes Kubernetes, Terraform, observability stacks (Prometheus, Thanos, Loki, Grafana, Alloy), and infrastructure tooling such as Helm and Kustomize, while not being limited to these technologies. I design and implement scalable, reliable, and secure platform solutions while mentoring engineers and driving best practices. With a proven track record in both architecture and hands-on delivery, I excel at bridging strategy with execution.

name: Daniel Sulzer
bio: I'm a DevOps Engineer from Austria, currently based in Switzerland. My focus is on automation, GitOps, Kubernetes and monitoring. I'm always eager to learn new technologies, and the CNCF landscape offers many exciting projects to explore.

name: Daniel Vazquez-Silva
bio: I'm Dan Vazquez, a Cloud Architect with a passion for solving complex problems through robust infrastructure, resilient systems, and thoughtful design. With over 15 years of experience spanning defense, private sector, and independent consulting, I’ve built a career focused on delivering secure, scalable cloud solutions that empower mission success and business transformation.I hold an active Top Secret / SCI clearance, a B.S. in Cloud Computing, and over a dozen industry certifications, including Kubestronaut, Terraform and CompTIA CSCP/CSIS. I run two blogs https://syntax.garden and https://danvazquez.com.

name: Danielle Cook
bio:
Danielle has worked in the cloud native industry since 2016 helping organizations adopt the technologies that make cloud native enterprise ready. She co-authored and launched the CNCF Cloud Native Maturity Model and continues to maintain it as part of her leadership of the CNCF Cartografos Working Group. Danielle is a co-author of the CNCF book Admiral Bash's Island Adventure with Phippy + Friends. She is currently focused on getting organizations to understand how cloud native achieves business objectives.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having been part of the cloud native community since 2016, I’m excited to welcome new members and help them understand how to participate. I’m particularly interested in becoming an ambassador to help all members do better at communicating why cloud native is not just technology, but makes innovation and business goals achievable.

name: Danilo Granados
bio: I'm a telecommunications professional with expertise in mobile core network engineering. Building upon my core network background, my interest in 5G and Open RAN led me into a parallel path that became what is now a journey into Cloud Native technologies. While leading a team that manages critical voice services in my current role, I've dedicated my personal time to mastering cloud-native concepts and developing a deep understanding of containerized network functions orchestration. As the telecom industry slowly adopts these technologies, my objective is to leverage my extensive telecom background with these recently acquired skills to help drive the industry's inevitable transformation toward Cloud Native architectures. I've documented key moments of my learning journey and technical insights on my blog: https://medium.com/@danilo.j.granados

name: Danilo Souza Silva
bio: Danilo is a Senior DevOps Architect at Amazon, specializing in AWS container solutions, Security and DevOps practices. With a Master’s in Computer Science, he leverages Infrastructure as Code to drive modernization and transformation in IT operations. His qualifications include an AWS Certified Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer and an extensive array of Kubernetes credentials from CNCF (CKA, CKAD, CKS, KCNA, KCSA). Danilo leads significant cloud migration projects across Europe, working with public sector entities to harness cutting-edge cloud solutions.

name: Danny Yang
bio: Agile explorers in the cloud native. Advancing steadily in the cloud field, offering precise and detailed solutions. Accumulating experience through practical application, propelling enterprises on their journey of digital transformation, while maintaining the initial spirit of explorers, seeking new opportunities in the cloud native.

name: Dara Gorky
bio: I’m Dara Gorky, a full-time Cloud Engineer based in The Netherlands. I’m passionate about continuous learning and regularly challenge myself by setting new goals, whether it's in IT or in sports like Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

name: Darek Barecki
bio: DevOps Engineer at mElements, part of the mBank group, currently working on security aspects of applications and cloud resources, primarily in Azure. Interested in eBPF technology. Creator and author of k8spacket (https://github.com/k8spacket), an open-source tool. Enthusiast of observability based on the Grafana Stack.

name: Dat Diep
bio: I specialize in designing and implementing scalable and resilient software applications that serve thousands of users in real-time using CNCF technologies, particularly Kubernetes. I'm passionate about solving complex problems and improving developer experiences. I enjoy working on challenges related to containers and Kubernetes and am eager to contribute to the community and share my learnings.

name: Davanum Srinivas
bio: Davanum Srinivas (a.k.a Dims) is a Principal Engineer with Nvidia working on Kubernetes, containerd and related projects at CNCF. Dims is involved in various Kubernetes SIGs and working groups like the Architecture, Testing, Node, Infrastructure etc.

name: Dave Altena
bio: DevSecOps Engineer who specialises in making secuirty more understandable for Platform Engineers. Always love to learn about new tools and techniques in this area, and love applying them both at home and the workplace. Building https://prlx.eu to help organisations getting their security in check

name: Dave Zolotusky
bio:
Dave is an engineer in Spotify's Platform team, where his focus has been core infrastructure, the data platform, and Spotify's use of cloud services. A noted evangelist for cloud native and open source technologies, Dave spurred Spotify to join the CNCF and remain active in the community, launched the Stockholm CNCF meetup, and is both a CNCF Ambassador and a member of the KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Program Committee.

In his work at Spotify, Dave has been essential to the adoption of CNCF projects like Kubernetes, gRPC, Envoy, and OpenTelemetry, as well as experimentation with Service Mesh. Prior to his time with Spotify, Dave worked at AWS, at VMware on cloud management software, and at Microsoft on the Office team.

name: Davi Vercillo C. Garcia
bio: Davi Vercillo C. Garcia is a Specialist Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services with expertise in platform engineering, container networking, and observability. He specializes in CNCF technologies including Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, ArgoCD/FluxCD, and Istio/Envoy, helping customers with cloud migration and infrastructure modernization. An active community contributor, Davi participates in KCD Porto and AWS User Group Lisbon since moving to Portugal, previously supporting OSS communities in Rio de Janeiro. He has contributed to several CNCF projects, primarily through documentation improvements and issue triage, demonstrating his commitment to advancing cloud-native technologies.

name: David Abrante
bio: Senior Systems Engineer with a love for all things containers and open source.

name: David Auffray
bio: I am passionate about cloud-native technologies and all open-source technologies. I am very curious and I like to share everything I discover. I test some cloud-native technologies to help my city community expand its skills. If I discover and/or do not understand something, I do not hesitate to create issues on open-source technologies to improve the documentation or features. I co-organize a Cloud-Native community with partners to highlight cloud-native and surrounding technologies, such as generative AI.

name: David Godwin
bio: I have over 15 years of experience in Automotive software development including 5+ years specializing in cloud-native technologies, I enjoy architecting and delivering innovative cloud solutions. My expertise spans AWS, Kubernetes, DevOps, and IoT, with a strong focus on designing scalable, secure, and cost-efficient architectures that align with business objectives

name: David Gondor
bio: I'm David Gondor, a Test engineer with a strong focus on quality and reliability. I'm transitioning into DevOps, expanding my skills in automation, cloud, and CI/CD. I’m passionate about building efficient, scalable systems that support fast and reliable software delivery.
location: Alphen aan den Rijn, Zuid-Holland, Netherlands

name: David Halfdan Haugli

I love new challenges both in terms of troubleshooting and figuring out how new technologies works.

Ensuring that everyone feels supported and empowered to succeed is what drives me.

name: Davit Harutyunyan

Alongside his academic pursuits, he worked as a Research Engineer in the Smart Networks and Services (SENSE) group at the FBK Research Institute in Italy from 2015 to 2020, and since 2021, he has been contributing as a Research Engineer in Corporate Research at Robert Bosch GmbH in Germany. His primary research interests focus on advancing 5G/6G mobile networks, Open RAN, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), network automation, management, and orchestration. He has extensive experience in edge and cloud computing, particularly in leveraging lightweight virtualization technologies such as containers and their orchestration. He is also proficient in using DevOps tools and public cloud services for efficient and scalable infrastructure deployment.

Davit is a lecturer and leading the course - Microservice Architecture - DevOps practices in the countries best universities.

As an ambassador, I look forward to mentoring new contributors, staying connected to the latest developments, speaking at events, creating tutorials, and connecting with the cloud native community. I am excited by the opportunity to contribute meaningfully as an ambassador, share my knowledge with others and help advance the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Doddy Kristianto
bio: I have worked in a telecommunications company for almost 19 years at a leading digital telecommunications company in Indonesia. I started my journey in the field of virtualization and cloud technology from 2015 until now. Physical to Virtual (P2V) and Virtual to Virtual (V2V) are the first experiences in virtualization projects that know the basics of cloud computing. I started planning, assessing and building cloud computing in my company since the end of 2019 by conducting several cloud technology assessment tenders and selecting hyperscalers (cloud provider) according to my company's use cases. our challenge is how we maximize the benefits of cloud computing by migrating monolithic applications to microservices from on-premises to cloud using hyperscaler, with microservices we will have agile delivery to support rapid Go to Market (GTM) from a business point of view, we can support multiple deployments or sprint releases according to the business requirements program every week, it is much easier to maintain our applications / services independently and much more. Therefore, we realize the need to have microservices knowledge by understanding in-depth knowledge of the Kubernetes Platform to support this so that we will have an agile environment that can support our business growth and provide added value and competitive advantage for digital transformation in our company. I started learning Kubernetes from 2022 until now to support all kinds of applications/services migrating to microservices in the cloud. by fully understanding this knowledge we can maximize the value of kubernetes to support our business in our company.

name: Dotan Horovits
bio:
Horovits lives at the intersection of technology, product and innovation. With over 20 years in the hi-tech industry as a software developer, a solutions architect and a product manager, he brings a wealth of knowledge in cloud and cloud native, DevOps practices, open source and more.

Horovits is a public speaker and thought leader in the fields of DevOps, open source and specifically observability, having been on stage at KubeCon, Open Source Summit, FOSDEM and more. He also runs the popular OpenObservability Talks podcast, and you can also follow his blog and articles.

Horovits has been a leader in the Israeli community, an organizer of the CNCF chapter in Tel Aviv, and an organizer of the Israeli editions of Kubernetes Community Days (KCD), KubeDay and DevOpsDays.

  • Podcast: podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/openobservability
  • Blog: medium.com/@horovits
  • YouTube: youtube.com/@horovits
  • Sessionize: sessionize.com/horovits

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I've been advocating for open source and for the cloud native stack for years, online, on stage and with local communities, and I'm looking forward to expanding this activity as a CNCF Ambassador.

Share his knowledge journey at blog.douglasluna.com - feel free to get in touch!
