Recent projects I have worked on involved the implementation of GitOps practices using Flux, and establishing a service mesh with Istio. I work extensively with Terraform in Azure, and have helped build out data platforms across Snowflake and Databricks.

name: Duong Le Hoang
bio: Hello! I'm Duong, a Site Reliability Engineer based in Saigon, Vietnam. I have a strong passion for exploring new technologies, particularly those related to cloud-native environments. Outside of work, I enjoy playing football and engaging in various sports activities

name: Dustin Emery
bio: I am an experienced backend software engineer focused on building platforms that scale. My work centers on cloud infrastructure, Kubernetes, and the broader CNCF ecosystem. I’ve contributed to technology initiatives at large enterprises across healthcare, consulting, and technology. I enjoy tackling complex challenges and engaging with the open-source community.
location: Dana Point, California, United States America

name: Duy Cuong Tran
bio: Hello, everyone! My name is Cuong, and I currently work as a DevOps/Platform Engineer in Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam. My expertise spans AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes, with hands-on experience in CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (Terraform/Helm), and multi-cloud platform engineering. I am certified as an Azure Administrator Associate, an AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional, and a Kubestronaut. I thrive in fast-paced environments and enjoy building efficient systems that streamline workflows and improve collaboration across teams. I strongly believe in lifelong learning and enjoy sharing knowledge through blogging and collaboration.

name: Dylan Da Costa
bio: I'm a Software Engineer with a versatile skill set spanning Dev(Sec)Ops, SRE, cloud, platform, and systems engineering, backed by over three years of hands-on experience in configuring, securing, optimizing, and deploying microservices. I specialize in leveraging cloud-native solutions and DevOps best practices to automate and streamline the software development lifecycle, driving faster and more reliable software delivery. I'm passionate about working with CNCF technologies like Kubernetes, Argo, Fluentd, Istio, Helm, and Prometheus—just a few of the many cloud-native tools I enjoy using to build scalable, resilient, and secure infrastructure.

name: Dylan Van Rijnberk
bio: Dylan is Technology Lead at Schiphol Airport with a passion for Kubernetes, cloud-native technologies, and modern application architectures.

name: Dzung Vo
bio: Certified as an Azure DevOps Expert, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional, and Kubestronaut.

name: Ebin Babu
bio: I'm Ebin Babu, an engineer turned event organizer on a mission to ignite the cloud-native revolution in Kerala. As a passionate evangelist in the open-source world, I juggle multiple roles – from heading operations at Stackgenie.io to co-founding devopsmalayalam.io and spearheading the CNCG Trivandrum chapter. My overarching aim? To cultivate a vibrant, collaborative cloud-native community in our dynamic state. Throughout my journey as an organizer, I've orchestrated over 100 online and offline events, fostering connections and exchanging knowledge among fellow cloud-native enthusiasts. It's been incredibly rewarding to witness this community flourish and expand. Together, we're nurturing a shared passion for open-source, Linux, Kubernetes, and the ever-evolving world of Istio. What truly fuels my drive is the diverse tapestry of minds within our community – constantly pushing boundaries and shaping the future of technology. I derive immense satisfaction from uniting these innovators and providing a platform for collaboration, ideation, and collective growth.

name: Edgar Liu
bio: I am a passionate Cloud Engineer, and I specialise in designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable cloud infrastructure solutions for my company. I have a background in cloud computing technologies, such as AWS and Azure. I excel in optimising system performance, ensuring security, and driving cost-efficiency. I am happy to say that I have attended the KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2025!

name: Edgar Vardanyan
bio: I am a skilled DevOps Engineer specializing in Kubernetes, container orchestration, and cloud security, with extensive experience across a wide range of DevOps tools and practices. I excel in designing and implementing scalable, secure CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, cloud-native solutions, and GitOps workflows. I have strong programming skills in Python and Java, which I leverage to develop automation scripts, custom tools, and integrations. Additionally, I have expertise in monitoring and observability, ensuring the reliability and performance of systems through tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and other monitoring solutions.

name: Edgaras Apsega
bio:
I am a passionate technologist with a focus on cloud-native technologies, particularly Kubernetes. As a co-organizer of Cloud Native Lithuania Meetup, I have helped to build a strong community of like-minded professionals where everyone is sharing their own experience. In addition to my meetup involvement, I am a speaker at technology conferences and currently work as an SRE at Vinted, where I bring my expertise in Kubernetes to help ensure the reliability and scalability of our systems.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because it enables me to connect with like-minded other ambassadors, share our knowledges and expertise and will help to educate and promote cloud-native technologies to a wider audience. The role also provides access to exclusive events and resources, as well as opportunities for professional growth and career development. Overall, being a Cloud Native Foundation Ambassador is a great way to give back to the community!

name: Edik Mkoyan
bio:
I run the infraheads DevOps agency where I also lead the development of our turnkey Kubernetes cluster management toolset called turnk8s showcased on awesome-talos repository. I blog mostly here https://medium.com/@info_98249

In the early 2020s, I actively advanced the DevOps movement in Armenia while overseeing Cloud and DevOps at EPAM Armenia. My leadership in DevOps engineering and abiding interest in AI led me to MLOps and now we partner with Netris, DVC and Outbound for OnPrem AI infrastructure deployment and management.

name: Edith Puclla
bio:

She became certified in KCNA and created a guide for others to become certified, too https://github.com/edithturn/KCNA-training. She also was a speaker at Docker Community All hands # 7, where she shared her experience in creating a Docker extension for Hoppscotch https://www.youtube.com / watch?V=uGADVJTodYE&t=14s

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because I like exploring the CNCF ecosystems and having fun doing it. It's also rewarding to share content with the community and meet people from all over the world. Thanks to the community, I have obtained many opportunities in my professional career, and now it is time to give back.

name: Edson Ferreira
bio: With over 7 years of experience in the tech industry, currently working as a Solutions Engineer at Sysdig, focusing on cloud native security. He actively contributes to open source by maintaining the Portuguese (Brazil) translations of the Kubernetes documentation, the CNCF Cloud Native Glossary, and OpenTelemetry documentation.

name: Eduardo Alonso García
bio: I'm a seasoned cloud-native expert with extensive hands-on experience in developing and maintaining cloud-agnostic platforms. I have specialized in Kubernetes management, leveraging Kubermatic and KubeVela for multi-cloud and hybrid cloud deployments. I have also worked on CNCF projects such as NGINX, Flagger, ArgoCD, and FluxCD , ensuring reliable continuous delivery, traffic routing and advanced deployment strategies.

This realization fueled continuous learning and self-improvement, leading to certifications in multiple cloud platforms, Kubernetes, and software testing. Outside of work, I'm a nature enthusiast with a strong interest in computer networking, storage, and systems reliability, especially within the cloud native solutions ecosystem.

name: Emily Fox

Her technical interests include containerization, least privilege, automation, and promoting women in technology. She holds a BS in Information Systems and an MS in cybersecurity. Serving as chair on the Cloud Native Computing Foundation’s (CNCF) Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and co-chair for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon China 2021, Europe 2022, North America 2022, Europe 2023, and CloudNativeSecurityCon 2023, she is involved in a variety of open source communities and activities.

bio:
Emin is working as a Solutions Architect and has undertaken tasks such as producing solutions related to Kubernetes, Cloud technologies and Cloud Native Transformation in general, and transferring best practices about these areas. He is also an AWS Container Hero and shares his experience with the community around these technologies. He is part of the organiser team of the official CNCF Istanbul Community Chapter (https://community.cncf.io/istanbul/). He is also part of the CNCF Glossary Turkish team and helps the local community to understand the Cloud Native terms in their native language. He publishes blog posts from his personal Medium page (https://medium.com/@eminalemdar) and also participates in Open Source and Cloud Native related conferences and delivers talks about these technologies. He is in the organiser team of KCD (Kubernetes Community Days) Istanbul conference.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Community activities have always been my biggest motivation throughout my career. Helping people and learning from the people by participating in community activities is extremely important for me. Cloud Native Community is really one of a kind and being part of this community is really like a dream coming true for me.

Becoming Kubestronaut is not only an achievement but also the beginning for me to deepen my knowledge.

More on https://speakerhub.com/speaker/eric-d-schabell

My journey began in 2022 during my first internship, where I was introduced to programming languages like Go and a wide range of cloud-native tools. Since then, I’ve been deeply involved in the cloud-native ecosystem, especially through CNCF certifications such as the Kubernetes ones, which truly hooked me.

name: Esra Siegert

name: Etienne Ehrhardt
bio: After more than ten years of experience in infrastructure and middleware integration in various environments, I've naturally shifted to the cloud native world by more specifically focusing on container platforms. During the last years, I've acquired solid skills in designing and setting up cloud-native oriented architectures relying on various container engines, OpenShift and Kubernetes. The main focus being integrating those complex platforms in on-prem trusted, secured and compliant environments, as well as designing more hybrid setups in AWS and Azure. Those state of the art container platforms bring tremendous agility features to micro services integration, but there are nothing without proper governance and without using the right tools sets depending on a wide range of contexts and use cases. The cloud native world and its vast eco-system is evolving at high pace and today's challenge for many companies is to make sure they're not outrun by this strong wind of change in the digital transformation race. It's furthermore also important to understand all those concepts, the way they interact and their many impacts.

name: Ettore Ciarcia

I handle migrations to major cloud providers and design cloud-native architectures, always promoting open-source software and minimizing vendor lock-in. I primarily work with technologies such as Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, Grafana, Velero and Nginx, which allows me to build scalable architectures, optimize costs, and use a declarative approach. Participating in events like KubeCon, KCD Italy, and Linux Day in Benevento every year, both as an attendee and a speaker, has given me the opportunity to meet extraordinary people.

CNCF Member , CNCF Speaker , Linux Day Puglia Speaker, Linux Day Basilicata Speaker, CometoCode member and speaker, AWS Meet up member, AWS Community member , Kubernetes Community Days Italy Organizer, The development of a career and a reputation as a reliable computing professional in both the creative and technical sides of IT, building on my technical knowledge of software, hardware and computing standards. I also aim to obtain a good and professional reputation as a world wide known IT trainer for Kubernetes , AWS, VMware and possibly others such as Google and so on.

Loving also to build knowledge sharing my consideration and my expertise and gaining knowledge from the students.

Hope to see you soon, never stop , keep studying.

name: Eya Touili

Earning the title of Kubestronaut wasn’t just an achievement. It marked a checkpoint in a journey shaped by late-night logs, failed deployments, and the thrill of digging one layer deeper. This isn’t just a phase. It’s the launchpad.

I am interested in CNCF projects to leverage their features and integrate them into daily work (e.g. Helm, Harbor, Keycloak etc.) and excited to learn more and more about the open source ecosystem!

With a strong focus on continuous improvement, he's also mentored and led high-performance DevOps teams, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and automation.

With a strong background in cloud migration, automation, and modernization, I strive to connect people with the latest insights in the cloud-native space, encouraging skill growth and knowledge-sharing within an inclusive community. Visit and become a member at https://community.cncf.io/los-angeles/

Additionally, as an ambassador, I will have the chance to connect with other like-minded individuals and share knowledge and ideas, which will help us all stay up-to-date with the latest developments in this rapidly-evolving field. Overall, I am honored to represent CNCF and am looking forward to contributing to the growth and success of this innovative organization.

In recent years he has been actively involved in projects touching such diverse areas as Quantum computing, IoT, and analytics, and actively participating in the Kubernetes project as part of the Release Team, SIG Contribex, and others. He currently leads the Cloud and Architecture domain at SAS, for the South West & East Europe region. He holds a BA in Archaeology from the University of Lisbon, where he is an MA student and where he also took Physics.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I see being a CNCF Ambassador as a great opportunity to engage with others both in the technical aspects of cloud-native computing and in the many ways that those interested can become active members of the community. Cloud-native technology has largely been developed through open collaboration, and being an Ambassador is taking a step towards more visible participation in building the community - and learning from it.

location: Charoen Sin, Charoen Sin District, Sakon Nakhon, Thailand

name: Hogan Yan
bio: Passionate software engineer who loves building cool stuff!

name: Hong Il Young
bio: I’m Hong Il Young, a cloud engineer based in Seoul. I’m deeply interested in building microservices architectures that ensure high availability and scalability in cloud-native environments. I aim to enhance my expertise as a Cloud-Native DevOps Engineer and accelerate my growth by actively engaging with the CNCF community.

name: Hongtat Tan
bio: HongTat is a Solutions & Software Architect with 15+ years of experience in design and implementation of distributed platforms, system integration and custom implementation. He leads teams in modernizing application and infrastructure, and has successfully transformed large monolithic architecture into containerized microservices architecture on Kubernetes.

name: Honoka Toda
bio: I am a Software Engineer specializing in backend development with expertise in Go, Kubernetes, and AWS services. I am deeply interested in distributed systems and cloud-native technologies, focusing on designing scalable and resilient systems. I strive to contribute to the growth of the cloud-native technology community while inspiring and positively influencing young engineers in Japan. Through these efforts, I hope to elevate Japan’s software engineering industry and strengthen its presence on the global stage.

name: Hoon Jo
bio:
Hoon Jo is a Cloud Native and Cloud Solutions Architect at Megazone soft. He had several presentations on cloud-native technologies in Ubucon Asia, Openinfra Asia, HashiTalks, Openstack & Kubernetes Korea and so on. And he relays valuable information from the global to local community and makes clips to understand easily in Korea. My interests are highly are kubernetes and related cloud native products. I am fully sure cloud-native help to change the world as well as business model efficient way. Here is my channel. - Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/HoonJo/ - Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/HoonJo

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: In my view, Korea is not rapidly catching up with the latest information from worldwide due to the language barrier and other reasons. Thus, I hope I will relay a lot of highly valuable information from cloud-native resources to Korean communities. Plus, if cloud-native resources could be better digested after cooking, I will cook them to bite easily, such as clips. As an ambassador, it pushes me to be more active and be responsible. It is a really exciting journey in 2023 :) hopefully.

name: Hou, Po-Lin
bio: Starting my career as a PHP Developer, I later transitioned into an SRE role through a fortunate opportunity. This transition not only broadened my technical horizon but also sparked a deep interest in exploring scalable systems and operational reliability. Along the way, through both work experience and self-study, I have been exposed to a variety of tools and skills, including CI/CD pipelines, container orchestration, and monitoring systems. I am constantly driven by a passion for cloud computing, cybersecurity, and mastering innovative technologies that push the boundaries of what is possible. My approach is guided by a curiosity for solving complex problems and a commitment to building robust, efficient systems. Feel free to connect with me to discuss technology and share insights on technical challenges!

name: Hrittik Roy
bio:
Hrittik is currently a pre-final undergrad, who has previously worked at various startups helping them scale their content efforts. He loves diving deep into distributed systems and creating articles on them and has spoken at conferences such as Azure Cloud Summit, UbuCon Asia and Kubernetes Community Days - Lagos and Chennai among others! His best days are when he finds ways to create impact in the communities he’s a part of either by code, content, or mentorship! Blogs: https://hrittikhere.github.io/blogs/ Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/hrittikhere Credly: https://credly.com/users/hrittikhere

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being an ambassador will help me continue the work I do and, moreover, it will help me meet new people and discover new opportunities. With the support from CNCF, I also plan to expand the cloud native community in my local region and finally get into video content. I also plan to post a few articles on the CNCF blog (like this: https://www.cncf.io/blog/2023/03/13/how-to-use-kubernetes-events-for-effective-alerting-and-monitoring/) and continue creating content in the form of articles.

name: Hsuan-Jung Chen
bio: As a certified Kubestronaut, I’m truly honored to be part of the Kubernetes journey. Along the way, I’ve met many talented and inspiring people who’ve motivated me to keep learning and improving. I’ve been gradually building hands-on experience in deploying and managing containerized applications, and exploring areas like Kubernetes networking, storage, and security. I hope to continue growing and contribute to helping more teams succeed with Kubernetes.

name: Huabing Zhao
bio:
Hi, I'm Huabing Zhao, founder of the CNCF open-source project Aeraki Mesh(https://aeraki.net). I'm passionate about Cloud-Native technologies like Microservices, Kubernetes, and Service Mesh. I share my thoughts on Cloud-Native technologies through my blog(https://zhaohuabing.com https://medium.com/@zhaohuabing). When I'm not working, I enjoy watching movies, swimming, hiking, travelling, and skateboarding.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be a CNCF ambassador because it's an opportunity for me to share my passion for Cloud-Native technologies with others who are interested in this space. In the meatime, I have the chance to connect with other experts in this field and learn from them.

name: Huan Wei
bio:
Huan has more than 15 years of work experience, and his current focus is cloud-native edge computing, distributed cloud, and high-performance computing. He is currently working as a Senior Technical Director at HarmonyCloud, a company located in Hangzhou, China, providing leading cloud-native products and solutions for hundreds of enterprise customers, including Kubernetes, PaaS, edge computing, micro service visibility, DevOps, etc. In addition, Huan serves as a Technical Steering Committe member of the CNCF edge computing project KubeEdge. Huan is an open source technology enthusiast and is currently committed to building an open source technology ecosystem in China.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The company I work for, HarmonyCloud, is an influential cloud native tehnology supplier in China and a long-term partner of CNCF. HarmonyCloud has helped many customers around the world complete the transformation of cloud-native technology. At the same time, I am currently working as a TSC member in the CNCF Project KubeEdge community, responsible for leading several SIG teams and working with other TSC members towards the graduation of the KubeEdge project. Over the years, I have also given speeches at conferences organized by CNCF. Therefore, I am familiar with the operation process of CNCF projects and understand the job responsibilities of CNCF ambassadors. If I become an ambassador, I will promote the maturity and promotion of Kubernetes, KubeEdge and more open source projects, and help users around the world to apply these advanced and open source cloud-native tenologies.

name: Hugo Cardoso
bio: Platform Engineer with a software engineering background, focused on empowering developer experience through scalable, secure, and reliable Kubernetes platforms. Making developers' lives easier by breaking down complexity and reducing cognitive load — one cluster at a time.

name: Hugues Connan
bio: DevOps Engineer and trainer on Kubernetes Application Developer and Admin. I have a keen interest in all things Kubernetes, focus on observability and FinOps. Using automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, GitLab CI or ArgoCD to apply the DevOps best practices and help teams to develop all the environments they need.

name: Hui Tang
bio: I've been a Google Cloud Architect since 2019, delivering comprehensive technical support and tailored GCP solutions. I'm passionate about helping customers modernize their applications, particularly through architecting and implementing Kubernetes solutions on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). I'm also deeply interested in open-source projects and cloud-native innovation.

name: Humble Devassy Chirammal
bio:
Humble, a Staff Engineer/Tech Lead at VMware and a dedicated open source advocate for over 17 years, also serves as a Ceph Ambassador. Since 2016, his pivotal role as a core contributor/maintainer to Kubernetes has been instrumental in its ongoing maintenance and evolution. Notably, he initiated the Kubernetes Bangalore meetup, uniting over 8k+ enthusiasts, and assumed an organizational role in the Cloud Native Bangalore chapter. Expanding his influence, in 2019, Humble spearheaded the creation and management of the Kubernetes Kerala Meetup, actively nurturing the Cloud Native community in the region while leading KCD Kerala 2024. His fervor for mentoring and empowering individuals drives his ongoing commitment. Alongside speaking engagements at various conferences, his impactful blogs on Cloud Native technologies underline his expertise. Furthermore, his authorship of "Mastering KVM Virtualization" solidifies his authoritative stance in the field. https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/graphs/contributors https://kcdkerala.in https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-bangalore/ https://bit.ly/k8sKerala https://bit.ly/k8sBLR https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/container-native-storage-39-enhanced-day-2-management-and-unified-installation-within-openshift-container-platform https://kubernetes.io/blog/2022/09/21/kubernetes-1-25-use-secrets-while-expanding-csi-volumes-on-node-alpha/ https://www.humblec.com/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be a CNCF ambassador because it offers a unique opportunity to actively contribute to the world of cloud-native technologies, which is a dynamic and rapidly evolving field. As an ambassador, I can foster collaboration and knowledge sharing among a diverse group of professionals, ultimately advancing the adoption and understanding of cloud-native practices. It's an inspiring role that allows me to be at the forefront of innovation and connect with experts and enthusiasts in the CNCF ecosystem, all while promoting the growth of these transformative technologies.

name: Hung Fai Leung
bio: Tech lover. Enjoys learning new things. Has a strong interest in databases and platform engineering.

name: Hung Tran
bio: Learner. Sport. Food. Joy

name: Hung-Ying Tai
bio:
I am the maintainer of WasmEdge Runtime and an active mentor in LFX mentorship. I am enthusiastic about sharing how to leverage the WebAssembly technology with the Cloud Native ecosystem, including giving talks at the conference[1] and hosting online tutorials [2]. [1]: https://kccnceu2023.sched.com/event/6c0f559281122a74f5292f3d05b5936e?iframe=no#video_stream [2]: https://coscup.org/2023/zh-TW/session/EFYC8R I am going to have more tutorials and information related to Cloud Native+Wasm on my personal blog (https://hyd.ai). Stay tuned!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: WebAssembly is new for the Cloud Native ecosystem. I’m excited to join the CNCF ambassador community this year to promote the connection between Could Native software and Wasm and bring this knowledge to local communities and university clubs/courses in Taiwan.

name: Husam Ahmed Chaudhary
bio: I am a 18x certified Cloud Engineer with 8 years of experience, specializing in Linux and DevOps. I have extensive expertise in solution architecture, DevOps practices, and security.

name: Husni Alhamdani
bio: Husni is a CNCF Ambassador and a Sr. Site Reliability Engineer, where he is responsible for building and maintaining infrastructure platforms. In addition to these responsibilities, he primarily focuses on architecting Cloud-Native solutions. He also graduated from the LFX mentorship Program in 2022 (Kyverno Project) and in spare time, contributed to some CNCF Project like Kubernetes, OpenTelemetry, Istio, Cilium, KEDA. He also founded Kubenesia (Indonesia's #1 Kubernetes & Cloud-Native Training Specialist) where he teach Kubernetes & Cloud-Native Technology.

name: Huzaifa Ahmed Gondal
bio: Platform architect and cloud-native specialist with a proven track record of delivering enterprise-grade Kubernetes and OpenShift solutions in the telecom and banking industries. I focus on building secure, scalable platforms that power mission-critical workloads, with deep expertise across infrastructure automation, cloud-native storage, and DevSecOps integration. My approach blends operational excellence with cutting-edge innovation, enabling organizations to modernize with confidence.

name: Hyehun Lim
bio: Currently, I'm a Technical Account Manager at AWS for FSI and Edu-tech. As my customers have used lots of K8S projects for their production workload, I have been studying this area for a couple of years to support them. As a Kubestronaut, I still have new things to catch up and explorer even after this. I still have a long way to go.

name: Hyeongju You
bio: I am Hyeongju You, a cloud technology specialist at Megazone Cloud. I have expertise in CNCF technologies including Kubernetes, containerization, and cloud-native architecture. I welcome opportunities to collaborate and share knowledge with others interested in cloud technologies.

name: Hyeongjun Noh
bio: Hello, I’m Hyeongjun Noh, a university student. Recently, I’ve been managing our school’s Kubernetes cluster server while actively studying various areas such as CI/CD, high availability, and Kubernetes security. I'm honored to join Kubestronaut and excited to grow together!

name: Hyewon Jeong
bio: I work as a Devops Engineer at a CSP company in korea. I'm using Kubernetes as a container orchestration

name: Håkon Solbjørg
bio: Håkon has a background in software development and an interest for DevOps. Automation, CI/CD, reproducible builds and pipelines - anything to make the builds and deploys of applications to go smooth, and when they don't, there is a reproducible build process to debug locally. It all started on linux servers before ascending to the clouds. As a software developer at heart, Håkon sees the deployment pipeline from code to running in production.

name: I-Chou Tsai
bio: I have extensive operational experience with GCP (Google Cloud Platform). I have a deep interest in Kubernetes and am progressively building my expertise in this area through continuous learning and hands-on practice. I hope to explore more new opportunities and technologies within the cloud-native field.

name: Ian Board
bio: A passionate SRE with a wealth of experience in various tech roles, Ian loves to gain deep technical understanding of the technology stacks he supports. Recently this has found him focusing on chaos engineering in Kubernetes clusters, to better understand common failure patterns and how best to mitigate against them.

name: Ibrahim Tayara
bio: I am a senior Cloud DevOps, DevSecOps and platform engineer and architect specialized in Azure, AWS, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes and scripting. I am also specialize in CNCF tools like ArgoCD, Istio, Prometheus, etc.

name: Ibrahima Birane Faye
bio: I am a passionate cloud-native enthusiast, deeply fascinated by Kubernetes and the endless possibilities it brings to modern infrastructure. With a strong background in DevOps and a love for solving complex infrastructure challenges, I thrive in the ever-evolving world of cloud-native technologies. Whether it’s automating deployments, optimizing clusters, or contributing to the Kubernetes community, I’m always eager to learn and share knowledge.

name: Iceber Gu
bio:
I love open source and am involved in many CNCF projects such as Containerd, Kubernetes,Kubeedge, WasmCloud & KasmCloud. I also created Clusterpedia and promoted its contribution to the CNCF Sandbox project. I organized KCD Beijing and KCD Shenzhen in China, and have been a speaker at Kubecon and many other events. I maintain my blog at https://icebergu.com/ and when I have time I share my thoughts on technology!

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am delighted to be a CNCF Ambassador. I am very grateful to CNCF for recognizing my work in the cloud native community. The influence of being a CNCF Ambassador allows me to better promote cloud-native technologies and the CNCF projects, make it easier to organize cloud-native events, and attract more people to participate in cloud-native construction. I will make more contributions to CNCF as an ambassador!

name: Igor Beliakov
bio: Ex-network engineer (switched my focus to Kubernetes in 2019), one of maintainers of grafana-operator (https://github.com/grafana/grafana-operator/)

name: Igor Eulalio
bio:
Container, Cloud and Kubernetes expert, organizer of KCD Brasil.

Currently main contributor of Falco Talon, a project from the Falco ecosystem, aiming to provide open source automatic threat response for Kubernetes.

name: Igor Grigorov
bio: Software Engineer passionate about microservices architecture and building robust and maintainable solutions. Lately, I've been diving deeper into cloud-native DevOps engineering, sharpening my skills in automation, container orchestration, and modern infrastructure.

name: Igor Ignatev
bio: I am a DevOps/SRE and Cloud Architect passionate about Kubernetes and GitOps. With extensive experience in cloud architecture, I specialize in designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure solutions. My special interest lies in automation and I am committed to developing my skills, expanding my knowledge, and staying current with industry trends and technologies.

name: Igor Nikolovski
bio:
Born and raised in Amsterdam, father from the former Yugoslavia, mother of Dutch descent. Married, father of 2 beautiful daughters.

Around 25 years professional engineer with experience in the fields of Infrastructure, Software Development, Databases, Operations and Customer facing Support roles. I love to keep an eye on the future of tech and be an early adopter/tester of new things. In a nutshell, this is who I am: someone who loves to keep learning, both professionally and personally.

name: Ihor Denyskov
bio: I am a Principal DevOps engineer at Oracle. Scope of my interests includes Clouds, K8s, CI/CD, system design, system architecture and security. I am always looking for opportunities for ongoing learning and professional excellence.

name: Ihor Dvoretskyi
bio:
Ihor is a Senior Developer Advocate at Cloud Native Computing Foundation, focused on Kubernetes-related efforts in the open source community.

He is a Product Manager for Kubernetes, co-leading the Product Management Special Interest Group, focused on enhancing Kubernetes as an open source product. Besides that, he is participating in Kubernetes release process as a features lead for multiple Kubernetes releases.

A Linux user since 2005 with a deep engineering background, Ihor has been responsible for projects tightly bound to the cloud computing space, containerized workloads and Linux systems.

His recent speaking appearances include talks at Kubernetes Leadership and Contributors Summits, OpenStack Summits NA and APAC, OpenSource Summit EU, ContainerDays EU, Google DevFests and other industry-leading events.

name: Ihor Matsapura
bio: I am a Senior DevOps Engineer specializing in cloud computing and automation. I’m passionate about AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform. Holding a master's degree in Computer Engineering, I always seek opportunities to learn something new.

name: Ileriayo Adebiyi
bio:
Ileriayo is a Certified Kubernetes Developer, Administrator, and Security Specialist (CKAD, CKA, CKS) with a passion for people and technology. Co-organizer of the CNCF Lagos community group and KCD Nigeria committed to the growth of Africa. A teacher who takes pleasure in democratizing complex technical concepts. He is the creator of Get Going With Kubernetes, which consists of book reading and a series of workshops to help people learn Kubernetes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The adoption of Cloud Native in Africa has been quite low compared to other regions. Becoming an ambassador provides me the opportunity to champion the adoption, development, and growth of Cloud Native on a bigger scale in Africa.

Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/ileriayo

name: Iliyan Petkov
bio:
I'm a seasoned IT professional with over 20 years of experience designing, building, and scaling high-performance IT infrastructures. As the co-founder of DojoBits, I channel my passion for technology into continuous learning, meeting new people at conferences and community meetups, solving complex IT infrastructure challenges, and sharing my experience through teaching. I also focus on driving efficiency with automation, consulting, and working with cloud-native technologies like Containers and Kubernetes.

Outside work, I enjoy reading, hiking, mountain biking, training martial arts, learning new languages, and working on DIY electronics and home automation projects.

If you want to learn more or get in touch, visit our website: https: //dojobits.io or connect on Linked-in.

name: Ilya Bombel
bio: I’m a DevOps engineer inspired by cloud‑native innovations and continuous improvement. Positive, open‑minded, really hardworking, and team‑oriented person.

name: Ilya Dvorkin
bio: Experienced DevOps engineer with a background in Kubernetes, cloud infrastructure, automation and software development. Passionate about optimizing deployments, enhancing security, and streamlining workflows. Currently exploring MLOps and improving skills in Go and Rust.

name: Ilya Fedotov
bio: I'm a DevOps and Cloud Engineer with more than 15 years of experience in IT.

name: Ilya Kozak
bio: System Engineer, diving deep into Linux, k8s, CI/CD automation, AWS, DevOps best practices.

name: Ilya Redkin
bio: I’m a Cloud Engineer with a strong focus on cloud-native technologies and Kubernetes. I enjoy designing scalable, resilient infrastructure and simplifying complex systems through automation. I also have solid expertise in AWS, with hands-on experience architecting and deploying cloud solutions using its core services.

name: Imran Hossain
bio: I am a passionate DevOps professional dedicated to building scalable, secure, and efficient systems while driving innovation through collaboration. I thrive on solving complex challenges and am committed to continuous learning and growth. I am excited to contribute to the future of technology, embrace cutting-edge advancements, and foster a culture of adaptability and innovation within the tech community.

name: Inhwan Hwang
bio: Specializing in Kubernetes and cloud-native security, I build resilient enterprise-grade services using Python and Java. With deep expertise in OpenTelemetry and distributed monitoring strategies, I help teams improve observability and system performance. I'm passionate about sharing practical insights and driving innovation through community collaboration, including the Kubestronaut program.

name: Inhwan Hwang
bio: Specializing in Kubernetes and cloud-native security, I build resilient enterprise-grade services using Python and Java. With deep expertise in OpenTelemetry and distributed monitoring strategies, I help teams improve observability and system performance. I'm passionate about sharing practical insights and driving innovation through community collaboration, including the Kubestronaut program.

name: Insu Kim
bio: Hello, I am a cloud engineer specializing in AI platform inference development. In my work, I actively utilize various CNCF projects in production environments, including Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, Argo Workflows, Harbor, and others. Recently, I have developed a strong interest in container networking and service mesh technologies such as Cilium and Istio, particularly for achieving fine-grained traffic management and enhanced security. Additionally, I contribute to the open-source inference framework "vLLM" and its community, with the goal of advancing scalable and robust inference solutions.

name: Inwoo Choi
bio: Hello. I'm an engineer with a keen interest in cloud natives. I've been working with Kubernetes for less than a year, but I think I personally achieved to Kubestronaut by approaching it as a play, not a study or work. I encourage anyone reading this to approach Cloud Native technology as a play, not a study or work. CNCF provides a lot of playgrounds for you to play in. Just Enjoy!

name: Ioannis Sevaslidis
bio: I'm Ioannis Sevaslidis, a cloud-native enthusiast with hands-on expertise in Kubernetes, Istio, Kyverno, Kafka, and the Strimzi operator. I enjoy staying up to date with the latest developments in the ecosystem and continuously applying best practices in real-world environments.

name: Irakli Ghvinianidze
bio: Just Ops

name: Iris Dyrmishi
bio: I am a Senior Observability Engineer at Miro with a strong passion for Observability and platform engineering, making these fields the center of my career. I focus on building solutions that make complex systems more transparent and reliable. Observability is more than just a skill for me; it’s a philosophy I enjoy sharing through speaking, writing, and collaborating with others. I’m also one of the organizers of Kubernetes Community Days(KCD) Porto, where I help foster a vibrant, engaged cloud-native community. Medium: https://medium.com/@irisdyrmishi

name: Irvi Firqotul Aini
bio:
Interested in open source, machine learning, compiler, and natural language processing. Exploring language parsing with Rust and R. Part of Shadow of Kubernetes Release Team 1.17 and 1.18. Shadow Chairs of Kubernetes SIGs Docs. Emeritus-Co-Chairs of Kubernetes SIGs Docs. Contributing in Kubernetes, Planout and Ax (Facebook), Google Cloud Platform and Google API (Google), Keras. Programme Committee at Helm Summit 2019. Programme Committee at Grace Hopper 2020. Programme Committee at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon APAC 2020. Programme Committee at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon NA 2020. KubeCon and CloudNativeCon Track Chair for ML & Data EU 2021 NA 2022. Track Host for CPPCon 2022. Mentor At Grace Hopper OSD 2022.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to be a Cloud Native Foundation ambassador because it offers an incredible platform to advocate for state-of-the-art cloud technologies and best practices. Being part of this community allows me to engage with thought leaders, share knowledge, and contribute to shaping the future of cloud computing. Moreover, this role empowers me to bridge the gap between developers, businesses, and the broader public, fostering innovation and growth in the ecosystem.

name: Isaac Mecchi
bio: I am a cloud architect that run container workload orchestrated by kubernetes managed by gitops strategy.

name: Ishan Tripathi
bio: I'm a Staff Software Engineer with 8+ years of experience in full-stack software development and building modern cloud-native platforms. My core expertise lies in architecting secure, scalable systems using technologies like PHP, Laravel, Node.js, and JavaScript, while integrating DevOps best practices and infrastructure automation using AWS, Kubernetes, and Terraform. I'm certified across 13 domains, including 7X AWS, 5X Kubernetes, and 1X Terraform, and I focus on delivering resilient, high-performance systems that balance code quality, security, and operational efficiency. In recent years, I’ve expanded into the CNCF ecosystem, working on platform engineering initiatives, CI/CD pipelines, and internal developer tooling that bridge the gap between development and infrastructure. I’m passionate about solving real-world engineering challenges, mentoring teams, and driving continuous improvement across the software delivery lifecycle.

name: Isiaho Harun Mweresa
bio: I am a cloud and devops engineer with expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, IAC among other open source technologies. I'm currently expanding my expertise in the kubernetes ecosystem and focussing on securing container environments and observability.

name: Ismael Layth Fahmi
bio: Senior System Administrator at QiCard (Iraq), leading the design and operation of secure, high-availability cloud-native platforms ensuring zero-downtime for mission-critical financial services. Recognized for delivering resilient, scalable infrastructure that consistently achieves peak performance and uninterrupted availability. Committed to mentoring engineers, driving innovation, and strengthening the cloud-native community in Iraq.

name: Ismail Doğançay
bio: I am an experienced system engineer at a large and complex company, where I focus on the automated setup of clusters that adhere to best practices and stringent company policies. I specialize in CNCF technologies such as Kubernetes, ArgoCD and Prometheus, and have in-depth knowledge of cloud-native applications and infrastructure. I am passionate about leveraging the latest technologies to build scalable and robust infrastructure.

name: Israel Oña Ordoñez
bio: Isra has around 8 years of experience in the IT world and is the DevOps Lead at Deuna App, where he manages a team focused on automation and cloud orchestration using technologies like Azure, AWS, and Kubernetes. He has solid experience with tools such as Terraform, Docker and ArgoCD, leading scalable and secure implementations. He is passionate about technology and continuously learns new things to stay updated with the latest trends and tools in the DevOps ecosystem.

name: Itay Shakury
bio:
Itay Shakury is VP Open Source at Aqua Security, where he leads engineering and strategy of open source, cloud native, security solutions. Itay has some 20 years of professional experience in various software development, architecture and product management roles. Itay had initiated several local technical communities and events, including the successful CNCF Tel Aviv meetup group.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm honored to be recognized as a CNCF Ambassador, and join this amazing team of worldwide experts. To me, the CNCF is an intersection between two passions of mine - technology and community, which I have been pursuing since early in my career. I'm excited to continue to collaborate with the various technical working groups, events, projects and initiatives that the CNCF ecosystem continuously generates.

name: Ivan Ballatore
bio: Proudly Abruzzese, I love food, videogames and nerd culture. I am a software engineer working on both code and infrastructure, specialized in Kubernetes and Linux OS administration. I never stop being curious, learning and playing.

name: Ivan Georgiev Ivanov
bio: SRE with passion about DevOps, System Administration, and contemporary technologies that bring value to the organization and its customers. Experienced in Kubernetes, VMware, AWS, Automation, IaC.

I have a keen interest in Kubernetes, cloud computing, and modern software development practices, always looking to expand my knowledge and stay up to date with the latest technologies.

name: Ivan Rozhkov

My constant drive to learn and grow has always been at the core of my professional journey. Cloud technologies, Kubernetes, and the vast world of innovative solutions inspire me to continuously enhance my skills while sharing knowledge and experience with others.

name: Ivan Sukhanov
bio: I'm a Cloud and DevOps Engineer with expertise in managing cloud infrastructure and Kubernetes environments with a strong focus on automation and DevOps practices.

name: Ivan Totev
bio: I work in the exciting world of cloud-native solutions and private Kubernetes cloud hosting at NetBadgers Ltd. As the CEO and Co-Founder, I’m thrilled to be part of a team that specializes in deploying and managing innovative Kubernetes environments. Our mission is to simplify complex IT challenges and provide scalable, secure solutions that drive digital transformation. If you’re interested in how our private Kubernetes cloud hosting can boost your IT infrastructure, check us out at www.netbadgers.com. Let’s explore how we can support your growth!

name: Ivan Tymofiichuk
bio: I am a DevOps professional with expertise in cloud technologies, specializing in AWS and Azure infrastructure. With a strong background in Kubernetes, CI/CD, Terraform, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC), I excel at building and automating cloud solutions, often integrating them into GitHub-driven CI/CD pipelines.

name: Ivan Yau
bio: Ivan is a seasoned Cloud Engineer in leading enterprise environments. Leveraging his unique academic background in both Engineering and Business, he specializes in adopting and implementing complex, secure, and automated hybrid and multi-cloud solutions. His expertise is centered on architecting robust solutions using Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code, a wide array of Cloud-Native technologies, and A.I. to drive business innovation at scale.

name: Jack Alcides Torpoco Mucha

My passion for learning and sharing knowledge shines through my specialization in CNCF technologies and my leadership in technology-focused Meetups. For deeper insights into my projects and perspectives on innovation

name: Jack Kelly
bio: General tech enthusiast. Free/Libre and Open Source Software advocate. Jack Kelly has a strong interest in writing software, deploying it at scale, and doing so securely. Jack has a passion for nix and supports over 80 packages in nixpkgs, several of which being CNCF projects. With an interest in software delivery and nix it was natural for Jack to develop strong opinions around what constitutes a Secure Software-Supply Chain, and consults on such topics, in addition to facilitating as part of the In-Toto Steering Committee (ITSC).

name: Jackson Ching

I have led teams in systems integration and mentored engineers, enhancing operational efficiency through cloud, virtualization, and automation expertise. My strategic approach consistently delivers high-quality, secure infrastructure solutions across diverse industries.

name: Jacky Ng
bio: I started my IT career focusing on composing and running containerised applications on cloud platforms. I am also fascinated by the beauty of automation when I worked on IaC.

name: Jacob Avlund
bio: I'm a people leader at the LEGO Group, currently heading our Kubernetes and Observability teams.

name: Jacob Crawford
bio: Im a freelance DevOps engineer with a passion for open-source technologies. I have been building Kubernetes platforms for years using technologies like Cilium, Flux, Rook, Kyverno, Strimzi and many more. I'm always looking for projects where I can use my expertise in Kubernetes as well as learn new technologies from the CNCF family.

name: Jacob Michael Reichl
bio: DevOps Engineer passionate about Linux and CNCF technologies. Always learning, exploring new technologies.
location: Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm, Bayern, Germany

name: Jacopo Binosi
bio: I first encountered Linux at university, and from that moment, I never looked back. It was then that I realized Linux would be my lifelong "familiar." I enjoy solving problems and making things work the way I want. This, combined with my passion for Linux, led me to a career as a Systems Engineer after earning my Bachelor's degree in Physics. Time flew by, and I transitioned to the Cloud... and to Neovim (I’ve always been a daily Vim user and a fan of CLI tools in general). Today, I’m deeply into Kubernetes, but I still use Vim, Ubuntu, Debian, Arch, and occasionally work with some legacy infrastructure. Now that I’m a "Kubestronaut," I see this as a fresh starting point, without forgetting the tools that got me here.

name: Jacopo Nardiello
bio:
Founder at SIGHUP, I have been involved with Kubernetes and the CNCF since its inception in 2015. I am passionate about Kubernetes and full lifecycle management of production-grade infrastructures, open standards and currently serving in the advisory board of Linux Foundation Europe.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to continue supporting the CNCF, both as a community of like-minded individuals and as a technological ecosystem. My mission is to encourage organizations to adopt open source projects as a foundation for the evolution of their infrastructure and governance, promoting the use of OSS and Open Standards.

name: Jae Choi
bio: Technology leader passionate about automation with the mindset of "how can we make things better" and "let's get it done" I believe you truely understand the processes and systems if you look in the perspective of each stakeholder so I frequently put my self in the position of developers, security, data engineers, SRE and QA hands on involving writing code. This allows me to stay current and pragmatic when making technical decisions.

name: Jaehwan Suh
bio: Hello, I’m JaeHwan Suh, interested in cloud technologies and CNCF projects. I am currently studying and running the blog linked below: https://woodstock1993.tistory.com/

name: Jaesang Park
bio: Kubernetes Prometheus, Thanos Bash / Power shell

name: Jagadeesan Arumugam
bio: Hi, I am Jaga, Solution Arichitect and having 20+ Years of experience in IT, specialised in Virtualization. I am also certified GCP PCA.

name: Jagoudel Denis
bio: Automation is my credo. A convinced Pythonist. A lover of hacking. And also a big user of Kubernetes, whether onpremise or via cloud providers.

name: Jaime Andres Cubillos Patiño
bio:
Project Experience: Kubernetes, CyberSecurity, Helm, Identities, Istio, Open Policy Agent (OPA), Contaner Network Interface (CNI), KEDA Jaime Cubillos is a highly skilled Subject Matter Expert in Kubernetes, Azure, DevOps, DevSecOps, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and CyberSecurity, with more than 6 years of experience in designing, implementing and automating top-tier Cloud/Devops projects, migration workloads from on-premise to cloud and cloud to kubernetes. Fully Kubernetes Certificate KCNA, CKAD, CKA, KCSA and CKS, as a Kubernetes Adminitrator Jaime continious implement security practices at cluster level and workload level using Static Code Analysis and Dynamic Code Analysis tools, autoescalate techniques to ensure high availability and Disaster Recovery strategies in Kubernetes Clusters.

Jaime enjoy automating the deployment the kubernetes environments through Azure Pipelines and Helm Charts reducing the time to market of the applications and reducing the human error of deployment cross environmentst, with always in mind the importance of optimizing cloud costs to maximize business value applying FinOps Proficient in a wide range of tools such as Azure Devops, GitHub Actions, Docker, Aquasec, Terraform, Microservices, Azure, NGINX, Kube-Cost Plugin, OWASP, Velero. Jaime contribute to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) as Kubernetes expert for the Cloud Native LATAM community group.

Jaime is also the Chapter Organizer and Speaker of the Cloud Native Community Group in Colombia/Cali https://community.cncf.io/events/details/cncf-cali-presents-kubernetes-de-la-nube-a-la-sucursal-del-cielo/ Speaker kubernetes birthday 10 meetup in Bogota - Colombia https://www.linkedin.com/events/kubertenesbirthdaybashbogot7203870103833079808/comments/ My main goal is bring CNCF technologies closer to Spanish-speaking community to adopt cloud native technologies and be kubernetes evangelist.

name: Jaimes Joschko
bio: Problem Solver and lover of puzzles

name: Jairus Christensen
bio: Jairus is a DevOps engineer with expertise in Kubernetes, security engineering, and AWS. He holds a degree in Cybersecurity with a minor in Computer Science from Brigham Young University. Jairus has contributed to open-source projects like OpenSSL and Nginx and maintains a project called ClusterCreator, a tool to run secure Kubernetes on Proxmox. With experience in bare-metal and cloud environments, he specializes in creating secure, scalable systems and enjoys experimenting with his homelab to simulate enterprise IT environments.

name: Jake Nabasny
bio: Jake Nabasny works as a Cloud Support Engineer at Canonical and assists many Fortune 500 companies. He provides expertise in Kubernetes, Ceph, and Identity and Access Management systems. When not grepping his way through logs, he enjoys reading French philosophy and literature.

name: Jake Pineda
bio: Jake is an Membership Sales Representative at The Linux Foundation, working with the Cloud Native Computing Foundation. He brings experience in technology sales and cloud solutions, with an academic background that includes an Associate degree in Computer Science - Network Technology from Lehigh Carbon Community College, and ongoing studies for a Bachelor's in Information Technology at Western Governors University. Jake is dedicated to enhancing open-source software solutions in cloud native computing and network security.

name: Jakob Alkass
bio: I’m Jakob Alkass, a cloud-native enthusiast and lifelong learner with a B.E. in Computer Engineering from KTH. My work centers on Cloud, Kubernetes and IT architecture, where I administer a multi-tenant cluster and lead workload migrations into Kubernetes. While my current focus is architecture and operations, I still enjoy building hobby projects — a nod to the software development roots that first sparked my passion for IT.

name: Jakob Weinzettl
bio: Jakob possesses a strong affinity for cybersecurity, having held various roles within four distinct Security Operation Centers (SOCs), including Security Engineer, Incident Responder, Incident Response Manager, TriceratOps Automation Manager, and Acting Head of SOC. Utilizing his expertise in blue teaming and passion for red teaming, Jakob contributes to enhancing the cybersecurity posture of both internal and external organizations. His extensive knowledge is complemented by a range of industry-recognized certifications, including OSCP, OSEP, GCFA, GDAT, GSOM, Kubestronaut (CKA, CKS), and others. Jakob's contributions to open-source initiatives have garnered recognition from SANS Institute, a leading authority in cybersecurity research and training. His Sigma rules were referenced by SANS ICS, while his co-authored open-source project (ATC RE&CT) was featured in the SANS MGT551 course. Jakob brings a unique blend of technical expertise and passion for cybersecurity to his work. With a strong educational background in computer science and cybersecurity, Jakob has developed a deep understanding of complex security systems and threats. His dedication to staying at the forefront of industry trends and advancements has earned him a reputation as a knowledgeable and effective cybersecurity expert. Jakob aspires to achieve a pioneering role as the first hacker-CISO within an S&P 500 organization, leveraging his expertise and passion for advancing cybersecurity best practices.

name: Jakub Hoborowicz
bio: Former military and a passionate DevOps Engineer with over 3 years of production experience, driven by a strong interest in DevSecOps. I began my journey through self-learning, primarily programming in Python, until I discovered topics like Kubernetes and cloud computing. Since then, I’ve dedicated my time to deepening my knowledge in these areas and continuously expanding my horizons, while also sharing and exchanging insights with others. Currently working as a DevOps Engineer for the Polish government, where I help drive digital transformation by building and maintaining secure, scalable infrastructure and automating delivery pipelines — all to bring digital services closer to citizens.

name: Jakub Kokoszka
bio: I'm Jakub, a DevOps specialist from Poland at Software Mind. My passion lies in Linux, Kubernetes, and networking, where I excel at building robust, scalable solutions. Beyond my technical prowess, I'm known for transforming complex system challenges into elegant, efficient workflows—think of me as the architect who designs bridges where others see chasms. I'm constantly learning and eager to explore new frontiers in IT, driven by a desire to innovate and deliver exceptional results.

name: Jakub Krzywda
bio:
I have over a decade of experience in cloud and distributed systems, and hold a PhD in the field.

In the role of Cloud Native Training Manager and Senior Engineer at Elastisys, I am helping organizations adopt cloud native technologies and DevOps practices.

As the Linux Foundation Authorized Instructor, I teach all Kubernetes courses in preparation for CKA, CKAD, and CKS exams.

name: Jakub Scholz
bio: Jakub has a long experience with message-oriented middleware and currently focuses mainly on Apache Kafka and its integration with Kubernetes. He is one of the founders and maintainers of the Strimzi project. Strimzi provides operators and other tools to make running Apache Kafka on Kubernetes as easy as possible. He also likes to talk about anything related to Apache Kafka and Kubernetes.

name: Jakub Sokół
bio: I'm a DevOps engineer with developer background. Started career at Opera browser, currently at monday.com in Observability team. Recently, working a lot with OpenTelemetry - from maintenance of internal instrumentation distribution to overhauling signals collection pipeline using OpenTelemetry Collector

name: James Larrea
bio: I have worked with cloud and container technologies since 2018 when I discovered that life was more than just Linux servers. Since 2022 I decided to focus on Cloud and Kubernetes security and have built expertise in the CNAPP space. I am truly passionate about learning new technologies and troubleshooting complex issues.

name: James Spurin
bio:
With over 25 years of experience, James Spurin is an industry veteran skilled in various technical fields and adept at leading Engineering teams in top-tier Financial Services organisations. He now focuses on creating online courses and Technical Educational Content in areas such as DevOps, Kubernetes, and Cloud Native, incorporating hands-on learning experiences through container-based lab environments and has reached over 100,000 students globally. As a CNCF Ambassador, James actively advocates for Container and Cloud Native knowledge, education, and Kubernetes-based orchestration. His company, DiveInto, champions Cloud Native and consistently shares fresh content on its YouTube channel: https://youtube.com/DiveInto James has also established an inclusive community dedicated to Cloud Native learning, which can be accessed at https://community.diveinto.com

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be a CNCF Ambassador as it aligns perfectly with my passion for creating technical educational content on Cloud Native/Kubernetes whilst also Giving Back, a core-principle of the CNCF. The role supports me in more actively engaging with a diverse global community, enabling me to learn from others whilst also sharing my own knowledge and expertise. As an Ambassador, I will contribute to thought leadership in the cloud native space and hope to provide an instrumental role in fostering a culture of knowledge sharing, learning and innovation. Throughout this journey, I am also eager to support and encourage others in pursuing CNCF Cloud Native certifications - an endeavour I am both passionate about and an advocate for. Overall, being a CNCF Ambassador is a highly rewarding and fulfilling experience that allows me to give back to the community while staying updated on the latest developments in the field.

name: Jan Baarssen
bio: I'm a Azure Platform Engineer with a strong focus on Kubernetes. My favourite tools within the CNCF landscape are Helm, Cyllium and Istio.

name: Jan De Laet
bio: I'm a senior Cloud Solutions Architect and team lead with a strong focus on Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies in general. I started my cloud-native journey as a DevOps engineer and quickly grew into the role I am currently in. I'm constantly looking to discover and learn about new technologies and how they can make a positive impact for the customers I'm engaged with.

name: Jan Laudahn
bio: I work as a system engineer with one of the biggest system integrators and based in Hamburg, Germany. My focus topics are VMware related with respect to the Kubernetes related offerings. I like to explore new topics, tools, and possibilities and dive into the world of Cloud Native. Especially that there seems to be a solution for everything is one of my favourite parts. And if not, you can simply start to build it.

name: Jan Melén
bio:
Jan Melén is an expert in networking, open-source software, and cloud technologies, with a career spanning over two decades. He is a staunch advocate for Free and Open-Source Software (FOSS) adoption within Ericsson and the broader community he engages with.

Jan has served as a Research Leader for Cloud Research, driving innovations in cloud computing. Since 2019, he has led a team dedicated to CNCF open-source projects, contributing significantly to Ericsson's Kubernetes distribution, and fostering an "upstream-first" culture within the company. He now oversees Ericsson’s open-source contributions and coordinates collaborations with CNCF projects. With his technical expertise and leadership, Jan aims to support CNCF's mission and strengthen the global cloud-native ecosystem.

name: Jan Pipan
bio: Jan is a Systems Engineer at NIL Ltd., specializing in Kubernetes and virtualization technologies. He primarily works with Kubernetes clusters on VMware Tanzu, managing and optimizing various workloads by following GitOps best practices. His responsibilities also involve implementing robust and effective backup strategies for Kubernetes environments.

name: Jana Vonšák
bio: DevOps Security Engineer fascinated by the tech world 🤖. Fueled by coffee ☕. Hitting the gym in my free time 💪🏻. Here to grab a fancy jacket 🌞

name: Janakiram Msv

He focuses on the convergence of modern infrastructure powered by cloud-native technology and machine intelligence driven by generative AI. Janakiram contributes to Forbes and The New Stack on cloud native and microservices related articles and research.

name: Jang, Sung Il
bio: I’m a Cloud Architect at LG CNS, where I help clients optimize their cloud environments through comprehensive diagnostics focused on cost reduction and service quality improvements. My work enables organizations to use cloud resources more efficiently and strategically. I have a strong interest in CNCF technologies, especially Kubernetes and container platforms.

name: Janghun Lee

I am particularly interested in Kubernetes, ArgoCD, and Istio, so I am personally responsible for translating official documents into Korean. I strive to share knowledge and contribute to open source.

name: Jared Price
bio: I'm a DevSecOps engineer passionate about Kubernetes, cloud native technologies, and the art of continuous learning. I believe in being a '1.01x engineer' - focusing on small, daily improvements that compound over time. I spend my days building secure infrastructure and automating deployments, while constantly exploring new ways to enhance my craft. When I'm not tinkering with containers or learning something new, you can find me cheering on the Green Bay Packers and Arsenal.

name: Jaroslav Jánoš

I am expanding my expertise to containerization, cloud computing, security, and AI-related topics. Defining myself as an IT professional, I am committed to filling any gaps in the IT industry and continuously learning to bridge the gap between development and infrastructure, creating robust, secure, and scalable solutions.

name: Jason Ang
bio: Results-driven DevOps Engineer, specialising in Terraform, GitOps, design and develop production Kubernetes environments in AWS and Azure. Extensive experience in automation, leading successful migrations to automated infrastructure, and enhancing deployment efficiency. Known for guiding development teams to cloud-native solutions with achievement of operational excellence. Excited to contribute to a progressive company by driving DevOps excellence, leadership and delivering robust, scalable infrastructure solutions.

As we advance our cloud strategy and migrate to Kubernetes, I’m focused on expanding my skill set to effectively deploy, manage, and secure containerized workloads. Outside of work, you’ll most likely find me underwater—scuba diving is one of my favorite ways to unwind and explore.

I love the philosophy of Kubernetes and have a passion of using CNCF Prometheus for infrastructure and application observability & monitoring.

Dedicated to continuous learning, I’m always exploring new technologies to help clients solve complex challenges and optimize their cloud-native environments.
company: I'm currently working at Suse as a Rancher support engineer

name: Jawahar Jayanthimala Muniasamy
bio:
I am a cloud and open source enthusiast and DevOps Engineer with expertise in AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform etc.. While delivering software products end to end right from design

and architectural phase. I would love to explore more trend setting tools which preferably are mostly open source, which landed me here.

bio: Jay Koby brings more than a decade of experience working with a variety of organizations and technologies. He currently works as a Senior Observability Architect at Grafana Labs.

bio: I work as a DevOps Engineer at New York University Abu Dhabi, where I focus on delivering scalable and secure DevOps and DevSecOps solutions. I actively leverage CNCF open source technologies to design, implement, and manage resilient infrastructure for research and academic workloads. One of my key contributions includes building a workflow automation platform using Apache Airflow and Kafka, seamlessly orchestrating complex pipelines on Kubernetes to support data-driven bioinformatics research.

bio: I am a seasoned Cloud Architect with over 15 years of experience in designing and implementing robust cloud architectures across industries such as airlines, telecom, and healthcare. Skilled in Azure, Kubernetes, DevOps, and cloud security.

name: Jayton Tjon
bio: Communicative DevOps Engineer with over 20 years of experience in IT, designing and improving system infrastructures. Mostly focused on Kubernetes and CNCF technologies, whether they run on premise or in public cloud, I just love solving problems for my customers!

name: Jean Pimmel
bio: Jean Pimmel is a Computer Engineering graduate and Data Platform Engineer at BSC Analytics. Specialized in Kubernetes, Terraform, and observability tools, Jean helps customers by managing and optimizing enterprise-level cloud and Kubernetes environments, improving resilience and efficiency through cloud-native tools and best practices. Passionate about automation, Jean focuses on streamlining workflows, optimizing operations, and helping teams deploy applications reliably and at scale.

name: Jeehyun Moon
bio: Cloud & Site Reliability Engineer skilled in both private and public cloud environments. Experienced in operating and optimizing Kubernetes-based infrastructure, with a strong focus on reliability, CI/CD, and observability. Passionate about building well-architected and maintainable platform systems across hybrid cloud environments, while also prioritizing efficient cost management.

name: Jeetvan Shah
bio: Cloud and devops enthusiast with an immense passion in designing cloud architectures, automating application and infrastructure deployments, implementing security measures and ensuring high availability of the application. Always eager to learn how things work and how it can be optimized.

name: Jeff Davis
bio: Jeff is a Kubernetes Engineer specializing in designing and building cloud-native solutions for complex enterprise environments. With a strong focus on developing custom Kubernetes Operators and automation tools, he has successfully led the creation of innovative solutions that simplify application lifecycles and streamline operations. He is skilled in container orchestration, Infrastructure as Code, and cloud-native development, and is known for his ability to mentor teams and drive containerization strategies that enhance scalability and reliability.

name: Jeff Rescignano
bio: Jeff Rescignano is a DevSecOps Engineer with a deep passion for Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. In his professional career, he focuses on building secure, scalable, and reliable systems. Skilled in containerization technology, Infrastructure-as-Code and CI/CD, Jeff enjoys leveraging software automation to streamline development workflows. In his free time, he enjoys experimenting with projects in the CNCF Landscape and has been contributing to open-source projects for a decade.

name: Jeffrey Chin
bio: As a lead engineer and DevOps enthusiast, I’ve consistently demonstrated a proactive approach, taking ownership of projects and delivering with excellence. My commitment to mentoring peers reflects my passion for knowledge sharing and growth. Beyond work, I find joy in maintaining my Kubernetes-based home lab and creating memorable moments with my wife and kids.

name: Jeffrey Sica
bio: Jeffrey (@jeefy) is Head of Projects at the CNCF, with a focus on improving community and project automation. Before that, he's worked at Red Hat and the University of Michigan focusing on Cloud Native technologies and CICD patterns. Jeffrey has been a contributor to upstream Kubernetes, helping in SIG-Contribex, SIG-Release, and SIG-UI. He passionately advocates for open source development and recognizing and alleviating burnout. Meetups: Board Member for Orchestructure

name: Jehyeon Choi
bio: I am a cloud infrastructure engineer focused on designing, building, and operating Kubernetes platforms and private cloud infrastructure. My expertise lies in building private cloud environments based on open-source technologies.

name: Jelle
bio: System Engineer at a large government organization. I do enjoy working in a team but don't mind working alone. I'm all for quality of the products and services we deliver. Even though you won't find me on any socials I'm a pretty social guy :-)

bio: Cloud DevOps and SRE with experience of end-to-end CICD and Kubernetes administration, aspiring to be an expert on managing scalable and reliable cloud-native infrastructure

bio: Experienced Platform Engineer with a passion for anything Kubernetes and Containers.

name: Jens Renè Suckert
bio: I am a Technical Consultant working mostly as Cloud Engineer or Full Stack developer. I am passionate about Cloud Native Technologies, High Performance Computing and automation.

name: Jeong Jeho
bio: Hello, I'm a DevOps and Cloud Engineer with more than 3-4 years of experience in IT.

name: Jeongdo Lee
bio: Currently, I am working as a Cloud Administrator at Korea Railroad Corporation (KORAIL). I have a strong background in system administration and automation, as well as experience in operating and improving application or solution-based systems. Kubernetes remains an area of interest for me.

name: Jeongwoo Kim
bio: I am Security Platform Engineer based in Tokyo, Japan, currently working at LY Corporation. I specialize in Kubernetes and CNCF security, contributing to the development and internal adoption of Athenz, a CNCF Sandbox project focused on fine-grained authentication and authorization. I’ve led security product integration of Athenz into Kubernetes platforms to manage access control and service identity across microservices at scale.

name: Jeppe Lund Andersen
bio: I'm a platform engineer working on stateful services on Kubernetes.

name: Jeremy Garcia
bio: Jeremy is the VP of technical community and open source at Datadog, where he's responsible for developer advocacy, training, documentation, technical writing, multiple engineering teams, and the open source programs office. An ardent but realistic open source advocate with a pragmatic approach, he is the founder of LinuxQuestions.org, which is one of the largest independent open source communities on the web. An early podcaster, he's currently a presenter on Bad Voltage. He's also on the board of the Linux Fund. Before joining Datadog Jeremy ran a consultancy helping organizations implement open source programs, find viable open source business models, and grow technical communities. He's spoken at a variety of conferences, had a column in Linux Magazine, was an ambassador for Opensource.com, and regularly blogged about the intersection of business and open source. Outside of technology he is an avid runner and foodie, and long time Buffalo Bills fan.

name: Jeremy Rickard
bio: Jeremy Rickard is a member of the CNCF Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and a principal engineer on the Azure Core Upstream Team at Microsoft. He is also a Kubernetes sig-release chair and was previously the release lead for Kubernetes 1.20. Jeremy holds a bachelors degree from the University of Maryland and a masters degree from Johns Hopkins University. Jeremy is an avid runner and coffee drinker.

name: Jeremy Tan Shi Yong
bio: Opensource advocate. Kubernetes enthusiast

name: Jeroen Kruis
bio: I am a software engineer with a strong interest in cloud technologies such as Kubernetes and containers. I have solid experience in software development and a strong focus on software architecture and system design.

name: Jeroen Van De Lockand
bio: Consultant, Open Source enthousiast

name: Jerry Lee
bio: Over the years, Jerry Lee has run global IT businesses in cutting-edge technologies, including open source, cloud computing, big data, mobile, and deep-learning. Through the use of his skill sets and his extensive network, he has created synergy and contributed to business and social growth initiatives in not only the Korea market but also the entire Asia-Pacific region.

name: Jesse Meng
bio:
I am a cloud native believer and advocator with over 15 years of experience in cloud computing. I was an early contributor to Kubernetes and led its adoption at eBay for six years. I am currently working as a product and development owner of cloud native FinOps at Tencent Cloud, where I founded the open-source project Crane, which helps users optimize their cloud costs. I am also auther of "The Journey of Kubernetes Production Adoption Success", translator of "Cloud FinOps", and speaker on various cloud native topics including Cloud Native Campus in geektime.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador because I love cloud native and I want to share my passion and knowledge with others. I think cloud native is the future of software development and it can bring many benefits to users, developers, and businesses. I want to help the cloud native community grow and thrive by contributing to open-source projects, writing books and articles, and organizing events. Being an ambassador will give me more opportunities to connect with other cloud native enthusiasts and learn from their experiences. I hope to inspire more people to join the cloud native journey and make a positive impact on the world.
